description:
Nara is so great! Awesome energy, they have great sushi selections and Toro to boot . 

We ordered the buns, hand rolls, nigiri, and so much sake! Honestly really tasty. Happy hour 5-7 every day!
author: Hannah H.

description:
This is a very trendy, contemporary sushi restaurant where you can catch up with your girlfriends while drinking sake and eating sushi. They have happy hour here from 5-7 everyday. $2 off draft beers and $5 spicy tuna/salmon handroll. 

I've been here before and loved the Hamachi truffle. Pretty average price considering you're in the city. 

Would definitely  recommend swinging by if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Angela W.

description:
Dish: Negitoro Handroll
Cost: $5 during Happy Hour
Rating: 4/5
Review: After having been to japan, I'm so picky about where I eat raw fish now but I know I shouldn't be.. Japan ruined my taste buds because not many places in the US can compare.  However, this handroll specifically was good and fresh, but had a little too much rice for my liking. The fish was a little chewier than I expected, but the flavors of it all were good! 

Came on a Wednesday around 5pm and they have happy hour from 5-7 errday! I'd come back to check out their other selections. It wasn't busy at all at 5pm cause as my friends would call it, that's "Senior Citizen" dinner time.  Parking was also easy to find at this time as well.
author: Valerie T.

description:
I had high expectations for this spot since it has a 4 star rating. I have to say I was unimpressed. I guess maybe my standards are too high?

We came here for my husband's birthday dinner, excited to try the happy hour and the omakase. Happy hour wasn't spectacular. $1 off sake, $1.50 per oyster. $5 hand roll. My husband had the omakase but was not Impressed. It was just standard. He said the rice was hard on the edges of each nigiri piece. The fish did NOT melt in his mouth like other omakase we have tried. Was it because we went there on a Monday? I don't know! But the rice was obviously not cooked perfectly. Maybe it wasn't fresh?

My chirashi bowl was standard. Nothing extraordinary. Baby girl had chicken karaage because what else do babies eat a Japanese resto? No kids menu. Boo. Yelp says the resto is kids friendly. That means I expect a kids menu. Given, our server did mention that we could order a cucumber roll that wasn't on the menu for baby girl, but my baby only has one tiny tooth, so that wouldn't work. The truffle fish appetizer on the spoon was pretty tasty, though.

For what we paid, I expected more. The 10 piece nigiri omakase for $40 is not a bad deal but you get what you pay for. 

I will not be returning to this restaurant. There are way too many other restos with omakase that satisfy me in the Bay Area.
author: Regina B.

description:
The sushi was fresh and they had a nice interior vibe, but the service was just ok. 

Why I was here // went on a double date with my bf's cousin and her bf. 
We came on a Sunday night around 8pm. 

Atmosphere // intimate and cozy. This place has a clean wooden modern appeal. 

Service // Wasn't a fan. They came when we first sat and we ordered some sake because we weren't ready. They came back like 2 more times within 5 minutes asking if were now ready to order. We barely got to exchange words and settle in because we felt rushed to order.... and after we ordered and got our food they did not come around to check on us any more... 

Food // 
-Dozen oysters// the oysters were fresh, even though I'm not a huge oyster fan, my bf really enjoyed them. 
-chirashi // $25 // not a bad price for chirashi! Came with a nice spread of sashimi but the real killer for me was the rice. The sushi rice was plain rice, which didn't really elevate the flavor of the fish at all. 
-lychee sake // was a hit amongst the table 

Overall// I don't think I'll be coming back to this place, unless I decide to try out their happy hour.
author: Emily T.

description: We went during happy hour which helped us order a ton of food at a reasonable price. From the appetizers to the sushi rolls and nigiri, everything was fresh and flavourful. Would definitely return for the varied menu, reasonable prices and f treat fish. The happy hour tacos were one of the highlights and for $2 you have to try them.
author: Riley S.

description:
I love this restaurant and their happy hour! The oysters r super fresh and they cost 1.5 dollars each, we ordered so much ;) also the spicy shrimp taco is super tasty, the soft shrimp, creamy sauce inside that crispy taco is such a bomb combination, the best thing about it is that it is tiny, so u can stay elegant when u eat it. 

I love the agedashi tofu, the bonito flakes r super good with the soy sauce, the tofu is well coated with flour and fried evenly, very nice. 

Overall, it was a very pleasant experience, would go back in the future for sure.
author: Shuang W.

description:
I am a sucker for Happy Hour and Nara has AMAZING deal. 

Great oysters & mini tacos are ... woooo hoooo.
author: Thao P.

description:
I loved Nara so much! As someone who almost damn near never enjoys their sushi experiences most of the time (mostly bc of different fish allergies), for a sushi spot like Nara's to blow me off my feet really made it special to me.

One thing that definitely caught my eye was the availability of A5 Wagyu Beef, which is usually an uncommon thing most places don't normally offer on the menu. Anyone who LOVES meat has to definitely spring for it, as it's arguably some of the best meat out there alongside Kobe beef. The marbling of the meat really compares to no other, and also has such great mouthfeel to it as well. If you're down to splurge, I'd definitely order any of the menu items involving the A5 Wagyu Beef.

Wagyu A5 Sushi Roll ($24) - Highly recommend if you're here. Though pricey for rolls (I mean Wagyu Beef was always a pretty penny to be fair), it was completely worth. The light smoky saltiness of the A5 Wagyu Beef was divine, and I'd totally get this again.

Shrimp Pot Pie ($12) Also AMAZING. The flaky pot pie crust complimented the warm toasted center with the marinated shrimp in the broth. I would totally get this again if I came back.

Agedashi Tofu ($5) Lightly fried tofu topped with Bonito flakes and I think dashi sauce? Overall really good, as it was light and airy though flavorful. Definitely wouldn't mind picking this up again.

As someone who has pretty annoying allergies in terms of seafood (ie raw meats and other types of fish), I also really appreciated the diverse amount of options alongside their sushi, with some vegetarian options, which was also a plus. Normally for me at a lot of other restaurants there usually are a few/next to no options left for vegetarians and people like me who struggle with various fish allergies, so for them to have such an expansive menu was a plus.

Another bonus I had was not having any annoying allergic reactions after eating here. For me at many sushi restaurants, that's a pretty rare occurance, because I'll always tend to have some sort of cross contamination allergic reaction later on from something going on behind the counter. For one of the first times ever at a sushi restaurant, I didn't have any other problems post eating, which leads me to believe that the workstation behind the counters is also kept really clean!

The service was incredible. I showed up in the last half an hour before closing and they were extremely amicable, though it was last call. They also let us take our time eating, though we closed the tab early so they could close up shop around us faster. Everyone was extremely cordial and prompt, and I have no complaints on the service.

Also if you write a review and come back, you can get an order of hot sake on the house, with proof of course. 

Definitely in love with Nara, and I'd give them a 5. As someone who usually has issues going to a sushi restaurants, Nara really swept me off my feet and I loved it here. The quality of the food here, service, and overall ambiance was just great. Definitely coming back here again in the future!
author: Allison O.

description:
Nara is a pretty hip sushi spot! They have happy hour every day, and a pretty affordable omakase too. I came with my bf for dinner on a Friday, and we split a few dishes beacuse we weren't that hungry.

We decided to split the 10 piece omakase, the handroll sampler, and miso soup. The omakase was good, although each piece is pretty heavy on wasabi, so be careful if you don't like it haha. The presentation is cool, on a long wooden board. The handroll sampler had good portions of fish to rice ratio and fresh fish! I liked the salmon handroll the best.

Service was very friendly. I want to come back to try some of their more creative dishes, like the hamachi truffle or sushi/fish tacos!
author: Tara A.

description: This is a great sushi and sake joint in the Haight. I highly recommend the blazing glory roll. I would come back again.
author: Michael T.

description:
Growing up in SF, good sushi is hard to come by. Good sushi with great quality and with affordable prices are even harder to come by! If you're looking for the latter, you definitely want to give this place a shot. I came here to celebrate my friend's birthday and we had a table for 13 reserved during prime time dinner time, on a Saturday night. I arrived a lot earlier than my party and gave the hostess the name that the reservation was under. She said that she couldn't seat me until more people in my party arrived. What's the point of the reservation then if you're going to make me wait for a table that is already reserved. Oh well, minor set back into the evening.

Fast forward to dinner time. My friend and I split the 10 piece omakase (35 dollars), Special K sushi roll (18 dollars), and the handroll tasting (15 dollars). Yes, I know that's a lot of food but hey we're both swimmers, that competitive swimmer diet never goes away. The 10 piece omakase was good. It was my first omakase experience so I didn't know what to expect. The only thing I wish that they did was label what type of fish we were being served. 

I know that it was salmon and tuna. What type of tuna? I have no idea. The special K roll was also tasty. I liked it because they didn't have a lot of rice as most places do. This place was quite the opposite, little rice to lots of "stuffing" lol. The handroll was by far my favorite, again not much rice and a lot of fish. If you're new to sushi, this is what you strive for sushi places to have. There are three handrolls to the order (1 tuna, 1 yellowtail, 1 salmon).  They definitely make you feel like you're getting your money's worth. 

The ambiance was also attentive. They came to fill our waters without us asking and constantly checked in with us to see if we needed anything. The food came out very fast as well. I would definitely come back here for sure. Oh! And minus one star because that waitress that took our picture for our friend's birthday said "okay, now open your eyes!" Bitch, what?!
author: Cynthia T.

description:
I came here for dinner and right before happy hour (ends at 7 btw) on a Friday and had no trouble getting a table for 2. I really enjoyed this place and the food and atmosphere. 

The BF and I ordered
- spicy salmon hand roll (loved it, very fresh, only $5 during HH)
- sake bomb roll (also enjoyed this)
-  Hamachi truffle (very flavorful and the jalapeno adds a great crunch)
- Omakase $40 for 10 peace(allll of the fish were fresh and tasted amazing. I don't think there was one where I did not enjoy. The sardine (saba) was my favorite. I actually wished I ordered the 14 piece after having this. 
- Tako (octopus) - Very very tender and not chewy at all 

All the food was amazing and came out quick! If you are ordering a lot, I recommend ordering some, then ordering the rest later so you have time finishing and savoring the food without being in a rush to eat. I also had this peach sake which was yummy (high recommend) 

The service was great and never had to ask for anything because they were always on point. I would definitely come again.
author: Micaela I.

description: Feels really cozy with the dark wood & warm light! Server was super helpful & kind (suggested a sake bomb roll, it was amazing!! Fish was fresh & delicious.) We're definitely coming back.
author: Jade N.

description:
Sushi magic right here.

After being recommended to come here, I came with two other people for an early dinner.  We came in on a Sunday night and there was no wait at 6pm.  Once seated, we were given their happy hour menu (5pm-7pm) and regular menu.  Their happy hour menu was very limited.  However I did order $1.50 oysters off of it, but probably not worth it.  They tasted whatevers and were teeny tiny.  Everything off their regular menu though was amazing.  We got the following:

Special "K" ($18)- This delicious and amazing roll included yellowtail, avocado, picked jalapeños, topped with amazing seared butterfish and truffle ponzu sauce.  OMG this is a must get for rolls.  The seared butterfish was generous on top and melted in your mouth.  It is so worth it and beautifully presented.  

Loco Spiderman Roll ($15)- This roll included spicy tuna, mango, deep fried soft shell crab, scallions, and topped with spicy mayo and eel sauce.  The roll had the deep fried crab inside of it but also two soft shell crabs that were deep fried also sat on top of the roll.  The presentation was really nice.  It was also well worth the money and definitely delicious. 

10pc Sushi Omakase ($35)- I don't share so this was all for me.  I asked for no tuna and they were nice enough to make sure it was replaced with something else.  The Omakase experience was amazing.  The beautiful presentation came out on a long wooden slate of wood.  I got 10 different pieces of nigiri.  All of my sushi pieces were super fresh in quality and all huge pieces of fish.  I recommend this if you are new to this place.  I was really glad I got it.  

Handroll tasting ($15)- This tasting included tuna belly, albacore belly, and salmon belly.  If you want handrolls then this is great for the value.  They were generous with the fish and all packed.  They were fantastic. 

Scallop Nigiri ($8/2 pieces)-  These were so good we ended up ordering a whole bunch.  Each scallop piece was huge, sweet, fresh and delicious. 

Live Sweet Shrimp Nigiri (MP)- These were also oh so yummy.  It was served with the head fried.  For two shrimps it was quite the presentation.  

We were all very happy with our orders and left totally satisfied and full.  I thought pricing was cheap for what you get.  All the fish quality was A+.  The customer service was excellent.  They were awesome about substitution or any alterations.  The inside is kinda small but a very cute intimate vibe.  There is also bar seating.  Reservations is recommended.  There was a huge wait when we were leaving.
author: Cat N.

description:
I have been on a pilgrimage to find the best tempura in San Francisco .My voyage has ended here at Nara . So crispy, so light, it just dissolves in your mouth!
Friendly staff and crazy fast service what could anyone else possibly want?!
author: Leslie C.

description:
Yum, yum, yum-yum, YUUMMMM!!!
Best....sushi....ever! We came here with a friend who lives close by and between the four of us got a TON of food which was the right way to go. The thing that puts this place over the top is they a few specialty rolls, and I often find that the specialty rolls are usually filled with tempura, eel sauce, spicy mayo, other sauces, and an excessive amount of roe. But every single roll we had, even when I was skeptical (i.e. Blazing glory), was so good. I can't remember everything we got but I'll do my best to recall:
Oysters (drool, soo good)
Uni, Sake and scallop nigiri
Spicy Tuna Taco
Wild mushroom tempura (beyond yummy)
Pork Belly
Rice Poppers
Miso soup
Jessica Alba Roll
Blazing Glory
Sake Bomb
Veggie roll
Avocado roll

Das it
author: Sarah H.

description:
This venue has seen several restaurants come and go over the years, so it's good to see Nara still going strong after 3 years in operation. The offerings here might not be 110% authentic, but the preparation and presentation aren't off the mark, the overall taste is pretty good, the atmosphere lively, and the service friendly. In short: a good place for groups, especially ones with lots of gringos.

Sushi connoisseurs will have lots to choose from, whether nigiri or sashimi tastings, or an all-out omakase. For those with more gringo tastes, there are hand rolls and goopy sushi rolls galore, as well as plenty of items which are marked as appetizers but could pass for small entrees, like the butterfish addiction, which was one of my favorites. To add to what's already a good selection of shareable items, they have a nice array of sake and shochu, plus a modest beer and wine assortment.

Service is one of their strong points - super friendly, fast, and helpful. Overall, a nice neighborhood go-to for groups large and small.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I'll make this short and sweet. 3.5 stars from me!

1 star for fresh fish
1 star for presentation
1.5 stars for the Uni

Omakase 10 pieces for $35. - great deal! The fish was fresh and really good but where they missed the mark was the rice. As I was making my way from left to right, I was hoping that it was going to get better but alas, got to the very last piece and discovered more hard pieces of rice.

The only saving Grace was the uni order. Uni from Baja was incredible and the sushi rice was on point. 

Overall, had a good meal. May come back if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Song C.

description:
Fresh fish, beautiful plating and presentation, and really sweet and attentive staff. We got ordered omakase and enjoyed ever bite of our meal!

Highlights were the salmon and hotate for me. And the ikura! 

Definitely going back for more!
author: Michelle C.

description: Came here on a Friday night. Surprisingly there was not wait at the time. We were hungry and ordered so many dishes on the menu. I have to say the food were so fresh and the presentation was beautiful. Two thumbs up. Highly recommended and would definitely visit again when I am in the Bay area.
author: Cecilia H.

description:
I came in here for happy hour after work on a Friday and it is a great value!! They have a 10-pièce omakase for $40 and a great selection of sales with happy hour deals. We ordered the hamachi truffle, omakase, salmon hand roll, and a sake bomb roll. The hamachi truffle was delicious and flavorful! The omakase was amazing and had such a great variety of flavors of fish! Yum! The salmon handroll was solid, nothing special but still pretty yummy and the sake bomb roll was loaded with delicious ingredients. It was a party in my mouth!!

All the food was good, but I really enjoyed washing it down with some high-quality sake and I thought it had excellent customers service and a peaceful, yet hip, ambience!

Highly recommend to anyone looking for good Japanese in the Haight and especially if you can make their happy hour!
author: Phillip V.

description:
Unfortunately, both times we've been to Nara have been extremely disappointing. We thought we'd give Nara another try after the first visit because of its shockingly high reviews and proximity to our apartment. The food at this place seems to be tailored towards a Western palette; we noticed a lot of overpowering sauces and not a lot of subtly that we love about Japanese food.

We've ordered appetizers, entrees, and sushi; overall, the dishes have been bland, overcooked, and overpriced. We had to send back the "Baby Got Back" and "Yellowtail Collar" because both were severely overcooked and dry - even the waitress agreed. However, we did think the Oink Belly was cooked perfectly.

Although the food is not satisfactory, we're giving Nara two-stars because they have been accommodating and nice. The kitchen remade the dishes that were overcooked and brought out an extra dish. We would have preferred just getting the food comped because the remade dishes were still subpar but I appreciate their customer-first attitude. 

We wanted to like Nara due to it's appetizing menu and nice waitstaff, but despite it's fantastic reviews (we are still mystified at the 4.5+ yelp rating...) we will not be coming back.
author: Yuchen L.

description:
Rolls are the way to go here. Plus the other dishes they have. 

Truffle hamachi, spicy pork buns, and special k roll. 

Tried a couple of nigiris (chu toro, wagyu, uni) but for the price they weren't that great. Get the most bang for your buck with other items on the menu
author: Laura D.

description: Everything looks super tasty and brought out to us in record time, however lacking in flavor for something as flavorful as the hamachi truffle and ankimo. Which was a shame because As a Chef myself I really want this place to be good and it could be so much better.
author: Francis V.

description:
Came here for a friends birthday. They sadly do not take reservations and we're quite crowded at 7 pm on a Saturday so we waited around for awhile, but it gave us a chance to ogle all the food coming out of the kitchen. I will say they make everything look gorgeous!!

We ordered 3 sushi rolls, a nigiri sampler and the sea bass. While the portions are definitely on the small side, the flavor and beauty of each dish makes up the value. Every roll and especially the sea bass were exceptionally well balanced both flavor and texture-wise and the staff was very generous in bringing out a complimentary birthday ice cream and mochi dish.
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
Sushi was fresh, nice vibe, was a little loud during night time on a Saturday. Better for a friends get together and eat place than a date place. We arrived around 8 pm, and waited about 15 minutes.

Service was good and our server was really attentive to us.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Nara is an exceptionally good neighborhood sushi spot.

While sashimi and nigiri here are both pretty good, Nara's specialty rolls make this spot really stand out. They're unique and creative, and all the ones I've tried have nailed it on flavor, texture, freshness, and presentation.

I don't think you can go wrong with any of their rolls, but I'd highly recommend the Special K, Loco Spider Roll, and Sake Bomb. Looking forward to trying more!
author: Kelly R.

description:
Long overdue post. And every time I come, my love grows deeper. There is no need for me to get into the details of each dish, as I've tried almost every roll, hot dishes, small/cold dishes, nigiri tasting, and chirashi, and think quality is throughout. Think of Nara as trendy social spot - not really like an izakaya, but somewhere in the middle between that & strictly sushi place because their non-sushi dishes are for sharing & it has a bumpin' and fun atmosphere. 

When I am craving sushi (but not JUST sushi), I default to this place. When a friend is in town, I take them here. When someone is looking for a rec, I tell them here. 

Some of my faves:
- Hamachi truffle 
- Shrek
- Sake bomb roll
- Big boss roll
- Rice poppers 
- Hamachi kama
- Ocean foie gras 
- Mr Tako balls 

For the quality and taste, you are getting your money's worth. VERY affordable. One of my favorite restaurants in the city.
author: Vickie Z.

description: This place has incredibly fresh delicious sushi. Each and every dish is served with unique style.  Environment is very welcoming and friendly. Can get a little loud when busy. Great place for an amazing sushi date or just a nice night out.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Jalapeño poppers with tuna - must have for an appetizer!

Service was attentive, friendly, and on point.

Omakase - 10 piece was incredible. Do yourself a favor and save the blue fin tuna for last. 

10/10 would come back again :)
author: Vee B.

description:
Nara is probably my least favorite sushi place in SF so far. I did not like their omakase offerings. The selections did not seem especially unique or thoughtful. The hotate sashimi dish $11 was probably one of the cuter ways I've seen scallop displayed lately. The oink belly dish $11 was too salty and basic. The uni nigiri was alright. I can't remember much about the rolls, they were okay, but not something we'd order again.

My brother ordered the spicy chicken karage $8.00 and some rice $2.00. The chicken karage was definitely OFF-tasting. I know. I know. Why chicken at a sushi place? But he eats what he eats. After I noticed he only tried a bite or two and left it alone, I tried it myself. It wasn't like normal karage or normal spicy karage - it had a weird dried pepper flavor. It was almost bitter. The off-tasting chicken (like it was old and not fresh) was overly deep fried or wok fried (which made it extremely dry and hard). The dish was a hot mess.

I was curious to see if the server and/or management would notice that we hated the dish and do something about it. 

The server noticed after a while and asked us what was wrong with the dish and asked if we wanted it taken away. I explained what was up with the chicken in detail. She apologized and took the plate way. She did NOT take it off the bill. We were still charged for it although it was inedible. 

The $8.00 chicken karage was a drop in the bucket, so I didn't want to demand it be taken off our bill, but it clearly should have been. 

The inedible spicy chicken karage combined with the so so sushi offerings made me want to venture out to the other (unlimited) sushi places in the city. BYE Nara!

Our table of four was seated close to another pair. We heard every bit of their conversation. A bit awkward.
author: Thien H.

description:
First sushi experience in SF, and it did not disappoint! 
Scored a table immediately at 6:30, in time for happy hour specials that ended at 7. 
The presentation was beautiful. Upon tasting the fish, I was pleased to learn that the fish was not just pretty, but also delicious. Go with a friend and split the sashimi and sushi omakase, which are both reasonably priced ($35-45) and include fish I'd never tried (like butter fish).
author: Naomi S.

description:
I loved this place!! From the ambience to the service to, most importantly, THE FOOD, this place hit the nail on the head.

My friend and I came here on a Saturday night around 7 pm and there was ~a 15-20 minute wait. The server had us put down our name and phone number, and after walking around the neighborhood we got a text letting us know our table was ready. The inside was intimate and dim (great for a date!) but also a bit noisy/lively (also good for people watching!); it was clean, both casual and hip, and they had two bathrooms inside (score). We ordered the hamachi truffle appetizer, Kikumasa Taru sake (super fragrant and sweet cold sake), big boss roll (yums), sake bomb roll, and got a hand roll tasting (toro, bin toro, and sake).

The hamachi truffle did not disappoint and was delicious and fresh! They came in 5 spoonfuls of secret sauce (ie. truffle oil ponzu), yellowtail, and jalapeno. The kikumasa taru sake was on the sweeter side which I loved, and had just enough for 3 shots per person (I believe it was around $17 so not bad at all). The big boss roll was my favorite because the fish tasted super fresh and tender and had pretty huge meaty pieces; the sake bomb roll was also delicious because of all the sauces and all that but the big boss takes the cake IMHO. My favorite of all the dishes, however, were the hand rolls!!! They serve three different types of fish and omgaaaaaahd the fish was so effing fresh and just melts in your mouth. If you come here you have to try the hand rolls: the unsung heroes of Nara.

I'd recommend this place for a ladies night out or a second/third date with a special someone (it's a bit loud for a first date you might feel like you're yelling the whole time if there are a bunch of large groups haha). This place had a cool vibe, the servers were super nice and gave us helpful suggestions on what to order, and I believe our total for an appetizer, drinks, roll and one hand roll (there were 3 hand rolls but my friend had 2 while I had 1 because I am a model citizen and superb friend thankyouverymuch) came out to be around $40/per person. Not bad for all the food you get! 

I will definitely be coming back to Nara again :)
author: Joy K.

description:
Second visit did not feel as fantastic as before. Was turned off by whatever detergent they used to wipe table or clean the floor--odor was strong


Foods:3.8, service 3.5, rounded up to 4 stars.

Hamachi truffle is indeed excellent. Grilled yellowtail is overly done. Unagi rolls and other rolls ok. Chef's choice is average. Ramen is not recommended--they have two: one spicy and one non spicy.

Service: over all not terrible. The server/buzzer lady brought out our orders super quick. Another nice smiling girl is very friendly and helpful. If the waiter would be more attentive and introduce/recommend their items a little more, that would be appreciated. 

Environment: clean and spacious, good for small party. But they might have used bleach or clorox to clean the kitchen or tables, the chemical odor still lingers. 

This sushi restaurant is a little similar to Pabu but with better sushis and more affordable. Would repeat!
author: S N.

description: This place is awesome. The sushi is impeccable and the service is super friendly and knowledgeable. I love the happy hour here they have dollar off hot sake, 1.50 oysters and 5$ hand roles. My favorite is the fresh uni with chopped o-toro.
author: Katherine P.

description:
This place is awesome! I live near by and never even knew it was here! The food is so flavorful and beautiful and the service and staff is so friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend you
Go and check it out!
author: shannan p.

description: Nice spot for sushi in Lower Haight. We ordered a few things to try and all plates had such nice presentation. Sushi was good, though I loved the oysters most.
author: Lillian B.

description: Love this place, very nice environment. Many choices of sushi and omakese. It's also at a convenient location to where our Airbnb is at.
author: Phoebe W.

description: Great sushi! Say hi to chef Kevin!
author: Scot B.

description: If you like hot sake and a wide variety of rolls, then this is the ideal place for you in the Haight area.
author: Mike T.

description:
Delicious food, great atmosphere and sake equals a n excellent night out with friends. Perfect for a first date or a dinner with a group of friends, you can't go wrong with Nara. Happy hour is 5 to 7 with deals on hand rolls and sake. 

You can get seating without a reservation before 7, but after that is rolling the dice, it fills up fast with the dinner rush!
author: Chris G.

description:
Despite its exceptionally tasteless name, the "Jessica Alba Roll" is actually very tasty, possibly among my favorites in SF thus far. That roll, in and of itself, is a four-and-a-half star item. My friend had a veggie roll, which he remarked was certainly among the best he's ever had.

The Omakase -- a ten-piece Nigiri sampler -- was on the weaker side of things; certainly weaker than comparable samplers at Ozumo or Otoro. It featured mostly the lower-quality and less interesting fish, with only one piece of tuna. I inquired as to the variety of the tuna, but didn't get a straight answer. There was, of course, no Toro on that platter.

I'm a little disappointed to have to give them three stars. I expect that I may give them four on the next visit if I stick to rolls, which seemed stronger in quality. I do note that they do mostly more modern/American-style rolls, with fewer traditional-style rolls on the menu. (For example, I didn't see a Kappa or a Tekka Maki anywhere.)
author: John L.

description: Seriously easily our new fav sushi place. Will be returning to try the rest of the menu. That butter truffle though....so amazingly delicious!
author: Teresa C.

description:
Amazing service!! The waitress made this such a pleasant experience and the food made it even better. The Jessica Alba roll was mouth watering plus a side of fresh jalapeños made it my new favorite roll. There are so many sushi spots in the city but their selection and service make them at the top of the list. 

Ps. Their hamachi truffle shooter things were TO DIE FOR. Like seriously I could die happy now
author: Nina P.

description:
Delicious food paired with an excellent atmosphere. 

On a Saturday night, I came around 7PM and seated at the booth (for better photo lighting). Within the next 15 minutes, the place filled up. The walls are filled with large sake bottles, and the wooden planks on the walls gives the environment a very modern feel. 

Service: Right when we were seated, the server brought a glass jug of water and cups. The cups are absolutely adorable. Allowed us several moments to settle down. Check-in with us to see if we have any questions.

We ordered several dishes: the spicy handroll tasting, sake bomb, chicken karaage, oink belly, and shorty glaze. 

MUST TRY THE OINK BELLY. This piece of pork melts in your mouth. I sat with amazement when the pork disappeared. It's kind of like a thick chunk of bacon, BUT BETTER. And the presentation was beautiful. ALSO MUST TRY THE SHORTY GLAZE! The large chunk of meat falls right off the bone. The outside is seared and glazed. If just eating in inside of the meat, there is a bite to it, and not quite hitting the "melt in your mouth" standard. The piece that's stuck to the bone, was the most flavorful. 

The spicy handroll had three types of fish (tuna, hamachi, sake). I would recommend trying the regular handrolls. We couldn't taste the freshness of the fish because all we could taste was the spiciness. The sake bomb was mediocre. Can never go wrong with salmon and avocado. I will say the presentation was too much. The pink flakes scattered on top of the sushi in a pile was overwhelming. There wasn't a wow factor to the sushi. The chicken karaage was extremely moist. It wasn't as crispy as I thought it would be, but none the less with a squeeze of lemon and the dipping sauce, it was solid. 

Would definitely come back again. This would also be a super cute place for a date night!
author: Teresa C.

description:
Food was super delicious, staff was all welcoming and friendly at first. Very good prices for what you get and very fresh tasting! The store was clean and the atmosphere was great. 

My only complaint would be we were told 5 minutes for a table, and it turned into 20. A party of 5 people came in after us, as well as another couple. We're all waiting and our table is called, we get up and another server tells the hostess that the couple that came in after us asked to be seated at that table, so she gave it to them. The hostess told us to sit back down and wait again. Me and boyfriend were pissed, but we waited. Then the group of 5 gets seated and we consider walking out. Bad business, you seat as they come in and when seats are open. We got passes over twice. But we were hungry and already there. Sadly it ruined the experience though and we won't be returning. I'll support another business.
author: Angelica E.

description: The Shrek and Hamachi truffle were spectacular. Prompt service, relaxed atmosphere and great food. Perfect date night spot!
author: Taran S.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant with decent nigiri, warm dishes and services. Particularly enjoyed the omakase nigiri, kimchi taco, clam soup, ribs, and jalapeño poppers.
author: Vivien S.

description: The hamachi truffle is amazing, and the ambience is on point. Friendly service as well. Love this place!
author: Sarah J.

description: A warm welcome right when you step through the door. They have an awesome happy hour with a 1.50 per oyster and the 2buck shrimp tacos are bomb. Dollar off hot sake never hurt anyone. It goes from 5-7 everyday. The good here is on point. The rolls are great and the poppers are killer- stuffed with cream cheese and crab madness. Definitely would recommend this place. The only complaint that I have is the Food comes out all at once and fast, really overwhelming. When you are finished with your meal then they ignore you. Other then that though a cool joint.
author: Allie P.

description:
I think I just found my new go-to sushi spot in the Haight. Affordable sushi, fast service, and delicious food!

Chef's choice sashimi- always a gamble getting sashimi at a new sushi place. Will it be good? Are you about to have really poor quality fish? But my friend and I both agreed, holy shit all the fish we had was amazing. The quality reminded me of Daigo in the avenues. The rolls were good


Rice poppers- good, not very healthy of us but fried yumminess.
Hamachi truffle- bomb, I'd order again
Sake bomb roll & Jessica Alba Roll- both were good, but man, I think I'd just order more sashimi tbh.

The appetizers and sashimi are definitely the highlights of Nara. The interior is sleek, the ambiance is trendy and very group friendly. Also definitely drop by for HH if you're in the area!
author: Arezou A.

description:
I went here with a group of friends on a Sunday night for dinner before catching a show. We started off the night with the both hot and cold sake and the two dozen of the Miyagi oysters. The oysters tasted fresh and were accompanied by lemon, ponzu, and hot sauce. The whole tabled liked them so much, we had to get another round of two dozen.

The other appetizers we got were the mushroom tempura (enoki mushrooms), Mr. Tako Balls (panko-fried sous vide octopus in white truffle mashed potato balls), Agedashi Tofu, and a couple hand rolls (spicy tuna and salmon skin). The pace the kitchen prepared the food was fast and we had a steady stream of dishes to pass around before we got to our main courses.

Everyone at the table got the 10 piece omakase. As the chefs were making the nigiri we watched in amazement as they prepared seven individual planks of wood holding each person's meal. To be honest, I can't recall exactly what each piece was because I was too busy staring at the beauty in front of me while our server was explaining them all. 

Each piece of sushi was very fresh and the rice they used complemented the fish well with vinegar notes and had good texture to it. Everyone had smiles all around as we savored our planks piece by piece - some people eating as slow as humanly possible to make the experience last longer. I distinctly remember "In The Air Tonight" by Phil Collins playing in the restaurant while one of my buddies was having an out-of-body experience eating the Hokkaido scallop nigiri (LMAO). The iconic drum break hit right when he took the bite. It was hilarious. We weren't ready for our omakases to come to an end so we also ordered a plank of Main Uni to cap off the night. Usually they come in twos, but they accommodated us by allowing us to get seven - one per person.

Overall, our party's experience at Nara was amazing. Our server Yumi was super attentive, a pleasure to talk to, and made sure we were all taken care of. Everything we ate and drank hit the spot, and we were having such a good time they even gave us another bottle of cold sake on the house! I'm not claiming this is the best sushi I've ever had, but the combination of the quality of the food with the service and atmosphere made for a 5/5 dining experience. I would highly recommend this place to anyone trying to get their sushi fix in the city.
author: Justin P.

description:
Really love the happy hour here!

Got Miyagi oysters for 1.50 each, $2 delicious tacos, & salmon hand rolls!

Definitely will come back for more(:
author: Brianne I.

description: One of the best dining experiences I've ever had! Couldn't believe the service, they're truly making America great again!
author: Daniel C.

description: This sushi place is One one of the Best since I have been in the Bay Area. Great service. Awesome VIBE and Upbeat Music. The fish is Ohhhhh sooooo FRESH. Yum.
author: CG F.

description: It was a nice day and we were taking a walk around the neighborhood when we saw a chalkboard sign advertising happy hour deals 5-7 pm "errday," specifically oysters. I haven't had a good oyster in a while so we stopped in for a quick pre-dinner snack. It wasn't very busy. Maybe a few other occupied tables but the bar area was full. Luckily we didn't need to sit at the bar to take advantage of HH. I got 3 oysters ($1.50 each) and a kimchi shrimp aco ($2). My bf wasn't too hungry so he got a draft Aasahi beer. Their drafts (only Aasahi and Sapporo) are dollar off during HH. They also have a spicy salmon hand roll and spicy tuna roll for $5 each. Not a big HH menu but decent. The oysters are the miyagi kind, small but salty, briny, sweet and fresh. . Really good. In addition to a lemon and hot sauce, it's served with like a sweet soy sauce, almost like a tempura sauce, I liked it better than the lemon. The taco looked small. But it was actually a lot of bites. The shrimp is deep fried. Also tasted like it was bits of shrimp, not a whole one. And it's covered in like a hoisin and hot sauce. I didn't actually see the kimchi but tasted the spiciness. I could prob eat a few of these. Haha. Poor reception inside so I wasn't able to look on yelp to see what else is good here. Oh well, next time. Oysters were a good deal, for sure.
author: Alison W.

description:
I came here for my birthday last time and got hamachi nigiri. It was amazing. This is the spot getting high quality nigiri at. 

The rolls are also really good! Also, huge XL bottles of sake that are super fun for birthdays :)
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Nara is a Korean run, Japanese restraurnt that specializes in really fresh fish. My friend suggested we come here for uni. We ended up getting a bunch of sashimi, some tempura and lots of uni! 

The restaurant itself is a little dark and I felt awkwardly close to the table next to us (I think it was a first date). But they have great music playing and the food was great. Not only was the hamachi, salmon and maguro super fresh, it came out on a beautifully arranged platter. 

They also have happy hour here. They have both drink and food specials. The service was good and the waiters were very attentive. The price is decent, considering that the fish tasted fresh.

Street parking is doable if you're ok with circling a few times and walking a few blocks.
author: Krysten I.

description: Consistently fresh sashimi at a decent price point! Nice sake and happy hour specials as well. It's been a while since I've been here, but the location is great for walking around the neighborhood, and for checking out Toronado across the street.
author: Stacy K.

description: This is my favorite sushi bar in San Francisco . And I have eaten sushi all my life and in Japan and Hawaii . Chef Kevin is a creative and gifted sushi chef . He smokes his own unagi and fish and creates art pieces . Come for the happy hour between five and seven and have $1.50 oysters!!! The order omakase and let the chef chose for you
author: Ina D.

description:
TL;DR - great vibes, amazing service, super fresh sushi

Last time I was here I got the live uni (served in the shell) and it was amazing! The rolls are creative but don't stray from focusing on the flavor of the fish.

I didn't try them, but they also have a ton of other appetizers and tapas for those of you who don't actually enjoy eating raw fish. 

Last time I was here, we ran 15 min late and added an extra person, but the staff were super accommodating and made it all work! Honestly I was so surprised bc most places would have just given us attitude. 

But yeah, check this place out!
author: Crystal Z.

description: First time here and they are so awesome! I got a beautifully presented bowl of green tea ice cream. The space is big and beautiful. This place is dope. They have tall tables and regular short tables.
author: Lauren C.

description:
This is a nice little spot for some good sushi.  The space is big and the service is always on point.  Everything I have tried has been pretty delicious.  There is some Korean influence on a lot of the dishes.  

The prices are reasonable as well.  Definitely a spot to check out if you are in the mood for some Korean inspired sushi.
author: Paul W.

description: Amazing sushi and sashimi. Great selection, incredibly fresh and friendly service. Perfect after a day walking around San Francisco.
author: Jeff P.

description: Great atmosphere, quick service and fresh fish!  Perfect place for a date night or to come with friends.
author: Brittany U.

description:
My fiancee and I have only been here twice, but that's enough visits to sustain us as regular club members. 

Our hostess, Stephanie, should deserve some kind of academy award equivalent to the food service industry because we have never seen her without a smile and positive attitude. 

And what are the odds that she is wearing our favorite colors tonight?? Yellow and blue, GO WARRIORS. 

Food to be mentioned... I'd be surprised if they don't receive some kind of Michelin ranking in a few years. 

Keep it up, Nara!
author: Geoffrey G.

description: Such a cute vibe! Came here for a friends birthday and had a blast at the bar. Also love edamame.
author: Nan F.

description: Great vibes, really cute interior! The menu is really creative, but with a good selection of classics.
author: Grace C.

description: Would order the boss roll and chicken karage again. Great ambience for a romantic date night or hanging out. Delicious
author: C W.

description:
If you've ever had supermarket sushi and absolutely love it than this place is for you.

We literally couldn't finish our "heart attack roll" which has spicy tuna and o-toro because there was watery and gummy.

We left if on our plate and it was an absolute waste of $15.

Overcooked spicy tuna rice popper. So I guess the rice is either overcooked or raw LOL.

We tried two types of toro the salmon and the tuna. Both tasted like a sushi boat.

And the "Shrek" which was an avocado with cold shrimp Tempura and funky tasting unfresh crab.

Service was slow, but the hype is big for this place, thought we're unsure why.

I had to even return the ankimo because it tasted moldy.
author: Jack R.

description: Nigiri is fresh and tasty. Nice environment and good service. I like this place and will come here again!
author: Ivan H.

description:
The food was presented in a beautifully artistic way. The service was excellent, atmosphere was hip, in a not-so-great neighborhood.
The menu had creative flavors and combinations, kudos for the chef!
For our personal preference, we like our food to be simpler when it comes to sushi. Our philosophy is good fresh food should not be insulted with a heavy dousing of sauces. Any sauce should be a compliment to the food, not overwhelm it otherwise it's disguising its true flavors and freshness.
author: A H.

description: This place has amazing menu, especially the hamachi truffle. After 10pm is extremely good.
author: Trang P.

description:
Everyday happy hour from 5-7! $1.50 oysters, and tacos, hand rolls, beers and sake on special. 

They also take reservations during happy hour so that was great. 

Is it the most authentic sushi? No, but with happy hour it's tasty and very affordable. 

Service was friendly and with our group's bday party, provided complimentary dessert with candles. 

I had a great time, and will definitely come back to explore more of their menu!
author: Mandi W.

description: Cool vibe, bomb food, great service. Food is fresh and comes out prompt. Will 100% be back. New fav sushi spot.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
This was our first time at Nara. When we first arrived it was packed! We put it ur name on the list and 10 minutes later received a text message that our table was ready. 
The three gentlemen creating rolls (and other menu items) were extremely efficient and got everything out swiftly.

They have taken the traditional sushi and made it California cool. Nothing is traditional, but it's is all very tasty. I especially liked the shriek, an original appetizer that you must try!
author: Jynessa L.

description: Our sever was so informed and passionate she made the process of choosing the food delightful  . The fish, shipped in from Japan over night, was a taste sensation.  Go here. You will not regret it
author: Janet W.

description:
Great spot! Good vibe and food was really fresh and fast. Would definitely recommend to friends to try out! 

We ordered the Handroll Sampler and the Chirashi.
author: Justin C.

description: The wait staff is great!! The HH was limited but loved the oysters!!! The tuna special is great, especially love the meat from the head, Toro, and the cheek meat. They just melts in your mouth.
author: Va T.

description:
Fantastic sushi and interesting selection of Japanese small plates. Conveniently located in SF's Lower Haight neighborhood, steps from many of the best bars in the city. Ambiance is modern and romantic, with high ceilings, candle lighting, and dark wood. Top 40 music on surround sound, but not too loud to have a conversation. Great selection of beer and sake. The young lady waiting our table was very cheerful and attentive.

I tried the Veggie Roll, which was far superior to a typical restaurant vegetarian roll. The large portion was packed with fresh vegetables, including asparagus, carrot, and avocado, topped with sweet mango and crispy zucchini tempura. The smooth kabocha puree and small pieces of yucca chips on top brought it to the next level. Another highlight of the meal was the Mushroom Tempura, a wonderful variety of lightly fried mushrooms-enoki, maitake, and other seasonal choices. The Wakame salad and miso soup were also excellent. Our bill was $80 for two people (just dinner, no drinks). I would not hesitate to recommend Nara.
author: Alyssa F.

description:
This is the best sushi in San Francisco. Me and my boyfriend love everything on the menu (seriously) but there are a few things we can never get enough of. 

Hamachi truffle - our favorite thing on the menu. We usually get two orders 
Maguro tar tar - another favorite. Kinda like a more delicious poke with pears 
Butterfish addiction - sooooo yummy. The Yuzu citrus sorbet is the best one 

We usually also get a couple rolls (the Jessica alba is always delicious) and some hot sake and we're happy!
author: Samira H.

description:
Sushi was ok. Service was not really there.

We ordered two samplers (nigiri and handroll) and asked if that was enough. Our server recommended a roll that had smokey flavors (Special K?) as something different.

The Nigiri was uneven - some pieces were really tasty and others the consistency was off. Handrolls were good but not particularly filling. We did not really like the flavor combination in the roll that was recommended.

Once the food came we only saw our server when we had to flag them down to get the check and pay. They never checked back with us and it wasn't all that busy.

Might come back for happy hour but wouldn't go out of my way to return.
author: Tmon B.

description:
My friends and I were looking for a spot to continue our Thirsty Thursday shenanigans one night and someone suggested Nara. The ambiance is perfect to get you in the mood to go out and drink! It's dimly lit with a lively crowd, so you don't have to worry about getting a bit rowdy.

Everything we tried was good and we topped it off with beers and a bottle of sake. Definitely ordered the hamachi truffle! Everything else is pretty standard for a sushi place. I'm definitely trying to find a time to come back and bring some more friends!
author: Estelle C.

description:
Found a new sushi place I love especially coming back from Japan with sushi withdraw. This place satisfied my cravings. Not your Michelin fancy pant experience but high quality, fresh and delicious sushi. And price is very reasonable. Service was amazing! Exceeded my expectations and made my friend felt super special for her birthday. 

Happy Hour is from 5-7pm. $1.50 oysters, and yummy spicy salmon and tuna handroll for $5. Also discounted sake and beer.

Highly Recommended: 
*Hamachi Truffle, yummy and great presentation. 
*10 piece Sushi Omakase - Wow it was delicious!!
author: Sandy B.

description: I love nara. great service, fairly quick, and great happy hour deals. try their oysters!!
author: Leah L.

description: Had a birthday dinner date with my girlfriend here on a Thursday night. It's one of the only sushi restaurants open later in the evening so that was a plus already. The setting was nice, large space with plenty of seating and room to move around. We ordered a sashimi platter and the presentation was top notch and the flavor was just as good. We also ordered a nigiri platter that came out nicely displayed on a 2x4 and taste nice and fresh. We liked the place so much we decided to order several large hot sakes to end the night there. Great place and good food
author: Mack L.

description: GreAt looking place the food is different and very good, open late, trendy great for Sushi lovers
author: Daniel M.

description: My friend and I came to Nara for dinner on a Friday night and were seated pretty quickly. We ordered the spicy pork buns, the tako balls, one of their specialty rolls, and the shrimp pot pie. We were pretty satisfied with the food, especially the tako balls and the pot pie, which were the perfect comfort food for the end of a long work week. The pot pie took a bit longer than everything else so my friend had to wait, but it was worth it in the end.
author: Khanh N.

description: Phenomenal sushi. Loco Spider-Man Roll and Sake Bomb Roll are must-haves. The Spicy Pork Buns as an appetizer are great too! Check this place out right by Fillmore Street.
author: Chris K.

description: This place is awesome! Very inventive rolls and the quality of the fish is great. The ambiance is amazing and the service is top notch. Our new favorite spot
author: Winnie N.

description:
Really great happy hour with killer oysters and spicy hand rolls. 5-7 pm. 

Omikase for sushi nigiri and lots of creative rolls and good sake choices too. Attentive staff and a really good overall meal.
author: Brian G.

description:
Great fresh fish, excellent service, reasonable prices, I will return.

Arrived at 7:15 on a Thursday, had a reservation, the place was mostly empty but jumping by the time we left. Ordered a variety of sushi dishes that the waitress recommended, and some excellent imported Japanese red ale, and some sake. Everything was fresh and tasty and the prices were very reasonable.
author: Jordan C.

description: This place is the bomb dot com. 1. There have celebrity sightings. (Zaza Pachulia, see photo) 2. They are friendly 3. They have a roll here named the blazing glory and it sure is blazing and is glorious. 4. They reward you for being a good a customer (hot sakeee!)
author: Andie G.

description:
Love that this place is open late! We came here not too long before the kitchen was closing but they still took the time to give us delicious food and great service. 
Super addictive sushi rolls!
author: Alisa L.

description: Really great happy hour with some nice appetizer selections and authentic  Japanese beer. We sat at the sushi bar so we got to see the chefs in action and it's really fun to watch. Was a fun ambience and reasonably priced. Fun twist on different types of sushi rolls as well!
author: Piaget F.

description:
The lowdown: 70-80% of the sushi pieces give you amazing freshness-for-value, while 20-30% other pieces leave you slightly gagging. Their fish supply manager needs to learn better quality control, but otherwise most of their stuff is great.

Since their 10-piece omakase is in the super cheap sushi range ($35), it deserves to be compared to similar shops. I'd say the average seafood freshness here is below that of $45 omakase places like Eiji Sushi, Kazu Sushi, and Daigo Sushi, but it is much fresher than another $35 omakase place (Wild Sushi in Inner Sunset). 

I really enjoyed the seared hamachi on a spoon with ponzu truffle, while another dish of yellowtail poke left me sort of queasy. The rock shrimp taco was superb, as were the scallop, escolar, butterfish, hirame, and salmon in my omakase. The other bites varied between strangely chewy or oddly and clumsily cut -- and 2 pieces of sushi were just plain fishy. This is such a pity because 2 bad pieces can really drag down a 5-star experience into a 3-star.

If Nara can do better quality control so that they eliminate the 20% of the less fresh fish, they would be a super stellar budget sushi bar. I'd say it's even worth raising the price a little to make sure quality control is better.
author: Ken H.

description:
Came here late night on a Friday night around 10:30 before they close at 11:30pm. We ordered the tonkotsu ramen ($14), the karrage (boneless fried chicken ($7) and these Korean buns ($7). 

Korean buns were great- quite spicy with the chicken but big fan of the presentation and the bun itself was soft and easy to really bite into. 

Karrage came with a spicy mayo and was quite good when it was hot - though I've had better karrage! Breading is crispy when hot so don't wait too long bc it doesn't taste as good cold! 

Tonkatsu ramen was different- probably bc the pork belly has grill marks and a smoky flavor. The broth wasn't as thick and definitely not as spicy as other places. Again, interesting bc of the smoky flavor from the pork. Loved the bok Choy and fresh bamboo shoots that came as toppings.

Service was good and fast - would come here again for sure to try some other dishes! Also has a great vibe for dates and cool trendy interior!
author: Kristie M.

description: This is our first time to Nara. May was our server and she is amazing! Lots of great options for food. The atmosphere is great as well. The combination of great food and service is always a winner! Recommend you check this place out if you are in town and in the area. It's also really close to a ton of great shops. We were in town to see a show at the Independent. Easy walk and parking wasn't too bad on a Sunday evening!
author: Josh B.

description: amazing sake!!!!! Definitely come here on a Saturday night because it's busy enough to have a dope ambience but just secret enough that you ain't waiting in crazy sf lines!
author: Farrah N.

description: Exceptional food, exceptional service, friendly and accommodating wait staff, can't really ask for anything more. My experience speaks for itself
author: Kevin L.

description: Had a lovely dinner at Nara with some friends last night. Sat at the bar and the service was great--I'll be back!
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Pretty good quality sushi and pretty good service overall. Nothing outstandingly excellent or horrible to note. There are lots of different types of rolls to choose from, in addition to the daily specials written up on the wall. 

Interior is spacious and clean, and it was pretty empty on Sunday evening. Nice location in Lower Haight as well.
author: RachEl L.

description: A different sushi experience. Majority of fish is smoked, but still managed to have plenty of fresh fish too. Rolls are actually great. Loco Spiderman had a fun presentation. Definitely try the cold starters: scallop. Skip the ankimo and smoked nigiris.
author: Gina C.

description: This place is amazing! I live really close to here and I'm not sure how I'm just discovering it, but it's my go to spot now! Their spicy edamame is incredible, and be sure to ask the awesome staff for recommendations on the fresh fish - they know what tastes great and you won't be disappointed! Will definitely be back here again!
author: Christian H.

description: The fish was very fishy. Great appetizers and I loved the waitress' nails. If you leave a review, you get free sake which is what I'm doing right now. Hello Nara people!
author: David Y.

description:
3.5 stars, love the ambience of this place, and good service. It's nice to be greeted by the chefs when you enter and leave the restaurant :)

Should definitely take advantage of happy hour! 5-7pm. $4 draft beers, $5 Large sakes, $1 raw oysters (not to be mistaken with the other miyagi oysters on the menu Bc the happy hour ones don't come with tamago and scallions). Loved the oysters though! My first time having just lemon juice, tobasco, and ponzu on my oysters. They tasted super clean, and not gritty or dirty. 

Other cold and hot plates we tried:

1) Spicy pork buns : good, but was expecting more in taste, pork was a little dry. 

2) Hamachi truffle : A MUST TRY! 5 pieces of hamachi served in fantastic presentation. Hint of truffle, cilantro, and jalopenos. Loved it. Probably the best thing I had at Nara's. 

3) Hand roll sampler: good choice if you want to try otoro, sake toro, and toro hand rolls for a fairly decent price. Although they were good - I was not impressed in taste or anything. I probably have had too many hand rolls before to think these were amazing or anything. IMO it was lacking the extras like cucumber, scallions or cilantro, and even sauce. A little ponzu wouldn't have hurt. 

4) Ray Ray Tako's: meh. It was my least favorite. Basically just cooked octopus with some sweet sauce, some baby tomatoes and radish. Nothing spectacular.

5) also had the edamame which I ordered with spicy butter and garlic butter. It was awesomeeee, wished it was more spicer, but I am a huge lover of garlic, probably the second best thing I had there. 

Def a nice sushi restaurant though, I'm glad I dined here! Nara's was definitely one of the better meals I've had in San Fran.
author: Christy D.

description: First time having sushi. 10/10 would try again. Great food and even better service. Hamachi and avo-che are on point.
author: Alex W.

description: Over the past 3 years, this place has only gotten better. I don't know how that is possible but Chef Kevin continues to upgrade his game and creativity.
author: Shirley S.

description: This place is badass! The oysters are freaking delicious, especially for $1.50. The aesthetic is very pleasing as well, which is an added bonus!
author: Elina M.

description: Super cool atmosphere . Good choice of fish.  I got the fried rice balls with tuna. They were good it came with some sort of sesame sauce. It was tasty. Good music was playing . I'm sitting at the sushi bar.  The tuna in front of me looks so good .
author: Anderson D.

description: The food here was excellent.  We had the hamachi truffle appetizer, the blazing glory, the special K, and the big boss.  They were all delicious!!!  Service was great too.  Ambience is chill but trendy at the same time.  I definitely plan on returning.
author: Julia W.

description: A m a z I n g!  Wow, order up and let the good times sashimi. The food is so fresh and delicious. Chef Kevin is the best. sola is a gracious host.  Totally amazing!!!
author: Bik G.

description:
Very surprised by high ratings and reviews. Sub-par fish quality and their rolls, while somewhat creative, simply don't taste good.

Ramen and sushi on their menu is also a bit of a red flag. Don't try to do it all, just pick one and do it right.
author: Evan H.

description: Went here with my brother and his wife based on strong reviews. Food was all average at worst. Individually everyone enjoyed a different roll which was good. And price wasn't awful either. Definitely recommend it when in the haight.
author: David A.

description:
Found the place through Yelp. Love the vibe : good music, modern feel, great service. I came around 6:30 on a weekday and it's definitely not crowded at that time. The restaurant had the daily specials written on the wall which is great. I would highly recommend the bar if your can. You really do see the chefs perfect every dish they make, even Togo boxes dishes. Here is what I got :

Mr Tako Balls is a lot more carbs than a typical takoyaki, but then I realize it has truffle mash potato in it. It's not bad, but the carbiness that comes with potatoes can be tasted. 

Hamachi truffle is the bomb dot com. Have it to start your night with the miyagi oysters and you won't be disappointed. I really like the ponzu they dress over the fish. 

The miyagi oysters are $1 between 5-7 for happy hour  served with lemon and a soy sauce like sauce. Definitely indulge during he happy hours. Surprisingly they are super clean, didn't taste muddy at all. I'm really happy with what they gave me. I will say that the soy sauce does not mix well with the lemon and hot sauce. I would choose one when mixing. 

Nigiri tasting has 7 fish that the chefs get to choose  I got: hamachi, salmon, golden eye snapper, ocean trout, striped mackerel, yellowtail belly, escolar. Not bad! I can't say that the salmon was super buttery, but you can tell you are getting fresh clean fish. It cost $25 for 7 pieces. Not bad to try if you do not know what fish is good here. 

Daily special: live scallop special. Comes with 2 sashimi, 2 nigiri, and 2 tempura pieces. Presentation is on point. It was okay though taste wise, I've had better scallops at other places.

Ankimo nigiri - I had it at Omakase and that's very hard to beat. The ankimo was a little cold and I prefer it warm. Would I pay $8, probably not.

Loco Spider-Man roll was the only roll I got. I see that ppl also get the blazing glory. I would say loco Spider-Man is their take on spider roll. It's different because there is no eel. Rate is a 7/10.  Probably wouldn't get this again. Nothing was special about it. 

I give it a 5 for great experience, great food, great pricing, and  happy hour menu. The food is fresh and   I left a happy women. Great for groups. Clean. You must try hamachi truffle and oysters (during hh of course ). Would definitely come back. They definitely catered to me and made me feel special..
author: Jackie N.

description: Probably my favorite sushi spot in SF! Came here a year ago for my first date and it's the perfect dinner spot/ date spot/ place to meet up with friends. Great hip music plays, great service w/ the most nice servers. I have no complaints. Shrek is my favorite ! This place does not disappoint. Highly recommended!
author: Chrishel D.

description: Best sushi I've ever had outside Japan! They have otoro that'll change your life. Happy hour is legit and they gave it every day not just weekdays! Service is friendly and fast and the ambiance is nice! Highly recommend!
author: Kristin S.

description:
Yum!  We came here for a quick bite on a Sunday.   We started with pork buns, salad and the Special K and Fillmore rolls. 

We sat at the bar which was nice because we got to witness Chef Kevin creating each roll by hand.  The service was actually pretty fast.  It was a fun experience because when our orders were done, we were simply handed the serving dishes.

My favorite roll was the Fillmore.  The sauce that was poured on top was special.  

I think most Japanese restaurants serve sushi pretty fast and don't really put much effort into creating each dish but that's what I really liked about this spot... So much attention to detail. 

Would totally recommend it!
author: Kimberly L.

description: Sushi was awesome! The O-Toro was well worth it. The menu included a good selection of cuts of fish for sushi/nigiri and plenty of appetizer choices.
author: Nick S.

description:
Excellent! The oysters were delicious, the handrolls were so good, and the Special K rolls were just decadent. I think it's the rice. Unlike most sushi places the rice is exceptionally flavorful!
Next time I am in SF, I am definitely stopping by!
author: Aida A.

description:
How does this place have this many stars??  I feel like a massive prank was just played on me. 
 Do people in San Francisco just not know what good sushi tastes like?  I always thought the West Coast had it better for sushi but I am no longer sure that's the case.

The fish was neither fresh nor well-cut.  Everything was difficult to chew and bite through, and visibly poorly cut.  The only thing I enjoyed was the tuna, and that was despite the odd cut (extremely thick).  It's not even like it's priced well.  $25 for chirashi which comes with about 7 slices of the standard fish (2 salmon, 1 tuna, 2 red snapper, 2 walu that I didn't even eat, a tsp of ikura) over maybe 1/2 a cup of (unseasoned) rice and a bowl of miso.  I will say my miso soup was fantastic.  

Avoid coming here, and if you're an out of towner looking for sushi in San Francisco, take all these positive reviews with a huge grain of salt.
author: Maya N.

description: I've been here before and enjoy their happy hour menu. It's from 5-7 on weekdays and includes $5 salmon or tuna handroll and $1.50 miyagi oysters. I'm pleasantly surprised with their $2 kimchi guac shrimp taco. I like that they have a variety of things to order that includes cold appetizers, kitchen dishes and sushi. The sushi items range in prices but I think their sushi omakase and nigiri sets are decently priced. I would definitely take a date here as the ambiance is really trendy and hip!
author: Anh Thu P.

description: The butter for truffle is to die for  highly recommended. Sake bomb roll  the host noticed us right away when we entered, very nice waiters when we were indecisive
author: Victor R.

description: Got the omaksase--10 pieces for $35. Most were great, some were aight. Friend got karaage chicken. Quite tasty. Great service!! And sake bomb roll was also tasty. Will be back :)
author: Samantha B.

description:
Nara probably isn't the first place that comes to mind when I think Japanese food. But that needs to change. I get tempted by the $1.50 oyster sign more often than I should every time I'm trying to go next door to Mad Dog for trivia. And wow, the oysters there are the freshest, most flavorful  I've had in the city--and perfectly shucked every time! More than just oysters, though. I love how friendly, polite, and efficient the servers. Not at all pretentious, either. Food arrives super quick, and every single type of sushi roll I've had has been spectacular! 
Also, this is icing on the cake and kind of random. But they seriously have the softest toilet paper out of any restaurant I've been to.
author: Rima M.

description:
The food here was delicious! However it was very upscale and bit pricey. 

We missed the happy hour ): but hopefully we can come back to it.

We had ordered the Hamachi Truffle because I had read the reviews on yelp that it was very popular. I enjoyed the fact that they were on serving spoons. The Hamachi was very fresh by the taste.

I ordered the jalapeño poppers, they had a kick in it because they had put spicy tuna in them! 

The Uni shooters were very good! Inside the shooter was Sake, Uni, quail egg, green onions, and tobiko. 

We had also ordered a bottle of Sake there, which the waitress was kind enough to let us know which ones were good. The bottles were abbot pricey.

The service there was good because the waitress kept checking in with us and was able to serve our food on time. 

Parking wasn't too hard to find though it's in a very busy location. We came here on a Wednesday night around 7pm so it wasn't too busy.

Definitely worth coming back again to try their specials that they have on the wall.
author: Yen L.

description: Great ambiance and awesome happy hour from 5-7 every day! Here with a friend who's a regular and excited to try some of these fun sounding dishes.
author: Sheena M.

description: Nice place with fancy food. Happy hour oyster is a must order. We ordered blazing glory rolls and sake bombs. I personally like sake bombs more but my friends like both.
author: Elena Z.

description: Nara was an awesome first stop on our trip to San Francisco. The staff was very attentive, and the food was beyond expectations. I would recommend this spot to anyone who wants quality sushi. Also...spicy edamame...get it ..trust me .. stop thinking about it and order it....Excellent ambiance. Great food. Great vibes!!!
author: Vinodh V.

description: My fave neighborhood sushi spot! Great service fun vibe, and they have happy hour. Always fresh sushi and very reasonably priced. Also gluten-free friendly :)
author: Kandace K.

description:
Unfortunately, the other bad ramen reviews are true -- the ramen here is really not good, and not what ramen should be. Boo. I had to try it because I love ramen and needed to know if it was good here *just in case*, but it was prettyyyy disappointing. Don't get it if you know what ramen should taste like! It was also severely overpriced for what it was, like $14?! Definitely go across the street to Iza Ramen (my #1 favorite ramen shop in the city) and wait in line for their $12 ramen, which is about 500% better than the one at Nara!

Moving on from the terrible ramen -- the sushi. The maguro tartar was pretty good. I enjoyed it, but my friend thought it was a little tasteless. The other rolls we got were pretty meh too. Not horrible, but not that great either. I likely won't be coming back because I would rather get my sushi at other places that I like a lot more (and DEFINITELY won't be coming back to that bowl of "ramen" -- still makes me a little mad to think about it).
author: Grace D.

description: This restaurant is my favorite sushi place in my whole life!! They always keep their fish fresh and  and the taste is soooo good!! Even their miso soup is the best lol. Also dessert was so bomb!! It was very beautiful and tasty. The restaurant is very clean and the staffs are super friendly. Chef Danny, Kevin and Eddy are experts and they made a special roll for me. I will definatley come back here!
author: Yunha K.

description: Ok Oysters, I like the atmosphere. Sushi was ok for night time bar. Nothing really special about the food.
author: Joi M.

description: Had the best sushi and sashimi omakasa of my life! Freshest fish I have ever tasted! They've got Holloween decorations all over the restaurant. Super cute!!
author: Stephanie O.

description: This is my favorite sushi spot in SF, the sushi is great, the service is fast and the menu is expansive. Their specials are always a treat - this time we had wagyu beef sushi and a live scallop (both pictured). Can't recommend this place enough!
author: Scott L.

description:
I'd say this place is a solid 4 stars. Came here for happy hour as a pre-dinner snack. We arrived at 6:50pm and the happy hour was ending it 10 mins so we told the waiter/host and he seated us immediately with almost a full house. SO HAPPY!

Ordered the oysters, truffle hamachi, kim chee shrimp tacos, miso soup, handrolls, and a couple piece of nigiri. We were told the truffle hamachi was one of the most popular things on the menu, but it was just bland and whatever to me. I could barely taste the truffle oil. The handrolls and nigiri were pretty decent. For that price point, it's actually really good :) 

I'd come again to try their omakase and non-fusion dishes when I don't want to pay the $$$$ for the real omakase experience. Fun place for large groups to eat and drink :)

Solid sushi joint.
author: Anna M.

description: Love the ambiance and the service was great. Food was absolutely amazing. The sashimi fresh as it can be. An explosion of flavors.
author: Jenette T.

description:
In town for a family wedding and heard about Nara. 
Ordered butterfish appetizer, butter lettuce salad, miso soup and  the small 5 piece roll. Best part was the roll . Yummy! Hot sake perfect on a chilly night. Noisy for my taste but food good & service fast & excellent.
author: Ange B.

description: My girlfriend and I came here for a date night on a Wednesday and it ruled!  Great service, amazing sushi selection and nice vibe. They played Boy George and other excellent music.  All around worth-it experience!!
author: cory s.

description: Omakase deal ($35 for 10 pieces of nigiri) was well worth it--the fish used was very fresh. The spicy hand rolls were also really good! Would definitely revisit Nara if I find myself in SF again.
author: Astrid G.

description:
Came to Nara with my bf the other night. The vibe was great, the people are excellent in service. 

We got the Shrek special, which was quite interesting, it was a ball of avocado thinly sliced and filled with shrimp, crab, and fish inside. We also got the big boss roll, and blaze of glory and chicken karage. 

Let's break down each dish and see what I've got to say! 

Big boss- OH SO PERFECT. The amount of fish inside, the ingredients, the material and the wasabi mixed with soy sauce to top it off. Oh so fabulous. The size was perfect, good amount, quality was good. Perfect. 

The shrek ball...You better LOVE avocado for this to be fabulous. Theres a bit TOO MUCH avocado for this, and I think towards the end we were pretty full, so I didn't enjoy this so much. 

We also got the blaze of glory. It's a beautiful, cool, amazing sushi. The light the side of it with some holes in the foil to let the heat seap in. The fish is great, slight, very rarely cooked. 

Great vibe, great service. Love this place. They charge for tea, which I don't appreciate.
author: Amy Y.

description: Great ambiance, great place to enjoy it with friends! Great location! Hope everyone gets to experience it if they visit the bay area.  Cant wait for the miso... oh, the rolls look beautiful,  a work of art... plus the team is friendly.  I enjoyed  it,  and hope you enjoyed it as well. Easy to find parking, so don't shy away from the place. Enjoy!
author: Juan R.

description:
COME TO NARA!

First time we went the first thing we experienced was the entire staff shouting and getting us. We also noticed the great music that was playing in the background. The ambiance here is fun!

The food is so good! Here's a few things I would recommend:
Appetizer:
- Spicy Handroll Tasting
- Shrek

Rolls:
- Blazing Glory !!!!!!
- Sake Bomb
- Treasure Island

I have tried a lot more but this is usually what I come in for. They usually have specials written up as well and every time I've tried one it's been pretty good! If you want a casual, yummy, not too expensive, fun, sushi spot, come here!!!!
author: Kassie E.

description: I have been to Nara before and always remember it being at least decent. My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine's day and we ordered salmon sushi, The Special K Roll, Loco Spider-Man Roll, oysters(for my boyfriend) and sake. The food was not great at all. The salmon sushi had the weirdest taste to it; I told my boyfriend to try it and he spit it out. The rolls were just so/so and it was expensive? My boyfriend said the oysters were great and they did beautiful plating with flowers and ice but that and the service was probably the only redeeming quality. Our waiter was super nice and attentive so for that and the oysters they get an extra star. I won't be back.
author: Hannah G.

description: This is my second time at Nara and certainly will not be my last. Such creativity backed by supreme quality in such a perfectly paced environment. One of the most underrated spots in San Francisco. Highly recommend.
author: Theo R.

description: This place is dopppppe. The Jessica Alba roll blew my mind. The Loco Spider-Man roll goes great with the killer crock sauce.
author: Melissa G.

description: Srsly my favorite restaurant in the city. My out of city friends from LA always want to come here and say its better than sugarfish - I believe them!!! Ive come here 3 of my last 4 birthdays and its been lit!
author: Kevin F.
