description: Amazing place super hospitable and great food.  Impressed at ambience and sake.  Central to area and good variety of food as well.  Sushi I would suggest and, think worthwhile to take chef's Re a
author: Neil A.

description:
The sushi wasn't bad- it just wasn't good. I am pretty confident I was suppose to get 8 rolls and instead got 6. Not sure what happened. I brought it to the attention of the waitress and she dismissed it. 

All in all, pretty forgettable sushi. 

I thought the saki was reasonably priced and was satisfied with it. 

Pat
author: Patrick W.

description: I loved the vibe of this restaurant. Our sever was very friendly and attentive. The food was amazing and we'll definitely be coming back very soon for the happy hour specials :)
author: Ray H.

description:
Stephanie, hope thats how you spell it, was an amazing waiter. She was hella attentive and made sure we always had what we needed. We ordered at least 3 dozen oysters and every oyster was perfectly shucked, it was beautiful. 

We tried to order the rainbow roll, but they didnt have it, hahaha jk we dont eat that basic sh.it. Anyways, they play Illenium and other bomb ass songz. Check this spot out
author: Steven C.

description:
I was super impressed by Nara. After having tried multiple high-end sushi restaurants in SF such as Kusakabe, ju-ni, Akiko, and more, I think Nara is almost as good as it gets in the city, barring my gold standard: Kusakabe.

I would highly recommend you try their two omakase options.

The space is beautiful, woodsy, and fairly well decorated so reservations are highly recommended.
author: Edmund A.

description: Wow this place is amaze balls.  We were greeted with "Hashemite!".  Got sat towards the front and was given this huge saki menu.  Was a bit overwhelming really, so I just asked for the house hot sake.  This place is very trendy and loud and busy and is a really a good atmosphere for dinner before actually going out.  The sushi was great... I loved the shrek appetizer.  Everything we got was delicious.  It is a bit pricey, but worth it, and worth the experience.
author: Nyla K.

description: oysters were on point. really like the uni and fish here. great service from staff. i also enjoyed the ambiance of the location, very nice
author: Tommy A.

description: Best sake bombs in SF. This is my go to sushi spot when I travel to SanFran! Can't wait to comeback next time
author: Carly S.

description: Place is great! Waiting staff is friendly, responsive, and very helpful. Would recommend to anyone in the area
author: Tanner M.

description: The sushi here was just fantastic. I've never had Japanese food from the west coast but if they're all like this then the East coast is seriously missing out. Our waitress was very kind and accommodating and the prices seemed very fair for the quality of the fish and preparation.
author: Matthew P.

description:
On my way to the Castro district, I spotted this place and was initially drawn in by the name, which included Nara, my favorite place I've visited in Japan. When I first walked in, I was happily greeted by the hostess with a friendly Japanese "moshi moshi," which made me feel right at home! 

I was also pleasantly surprised to learn that there was a happy hour going on while we were there from 5-7pm, which we made sure to take part in. I first ordered a Junmai Ginjo sake called Hakushika, which was affordable and absolutely delicious! So crisp and refreshing. My partner got an Asahi, which was a dollar off ($5 total) during the happy hour. 

Next, we tried some of the food on the happy hour menu. I got a few oysters for $1.50 each, which I thoroughly enjoyed, and a kimchi guacamole shrimp taco for $2, which was divine, and a spicy tuna handroll for $5, which also didn't disappoint!

So all in all, would I come back here and try out more dishes? Ab-so-lutely. I approve! :)
author: Brad P.

description:
As much as I love traditional sushi, modern fusion places like Nara can also be a good time. It's especially nice because it offers some "higher end" options while also having some good filler menu choices that won't break the bank. The fish quality here doesn't quite match up to the modern accessible-but-high-end vibe this place gives off but the rolls are creative, the service is excellent, and I just can't be too mad about $1 miyagi oysters.

For food my friend and I got oysters and a roll I can't remember the name of (it had escolar, pickled jalapenos, and a ponzu truffle sauce.) I got the nigiri combo and my friend got the It's Like Butter Baby w/ white rice versus the bacon fried rice.

Oyster quality is honestly pretty good for just a buck. Miyagi oysters are about as standard as an oyster can taste and my wallet is ok with that. The nigiri combo was a bit disappointing in terms of quality but for $25, it was almost a cheap basic omakase since it included less run-of-the-mill fish. I got: horse mackerel, Hawaiian amberjack, regular amberjack, salmon, yellowfin tuna, and ocean trout. The quality wasn't the best but for the price I didn't expect much. The taste wasn't clean and the texture was closer to mush. Not sure if I'd get it again.

The roll on the other hand was delicious. Escolar goes great with pickled items and I would definitely eat this again (if I could remember the name). My friend's Like Butter Baby dish was also good for the most part. The veggies really were drowned in butter laced with something else that's super addictive. The fish was cooked well but not all that fatty and honestly underseasoned. However, I know it's meant to be eaten with bacon fried rice. The white rice just makes the dish a bit too plain.

Overall, I really do love this place. While the traditional stuff may not be great, their more modern items are definitely delicious!
author: Vivian C.

description:
Nara is better than ever.  It's easily the best restaurant in the Lower Haight, and one of the premiere sushi spots in the city.  

As I said in my previous review the food is fantastic, as good as the big dollar spots.  Super high-quality fish, distinctive rolls, and an array of creative and delicious appetizers.  The raw oysters are as fresh and clean as those I've had at Foreign Cinema.

A special shout out to the Hamachi Kama.  Unlike most places that buy the kama separately, Nara uses enough fish to produce kamas of their own.  I'm told they often have only one or two a night, and that people call ahead to try to reserve one, it's that damn good. For me it's an A+, a perfectly prepared piece of grilled fish.

Nara also wins because it's a fun place to eat.  Great music, inviting space, cool vibe.  The host George is real personality, and his staff of sweetheart servers always make us feel like VIPs.  The Lower Haight can sometimes be dreary and grungy, but Nara is consistently high class.

While I'm at it, their take out is immaculate, as fancy in plastic as it is on the plate.
author: Cody V.

description:
I would describe Nara as a modern Japanese/sushi restaurant for social gatherings. NOTE: they don't serve liquor - only beer, wine and sake. We were able to make a reservation for a group of 5 on a Friday night. The restaurant was fairly empty upon arrival, but started to fill up as the night went on. We started out with the oysters which came with soy sauce as opposed to horse radish. Very refreshing! I then had the "It's like butter baby" grilled cod. Presentation was great and the cod was cooked perfectly. Given that it's on the "heavier side," I'd say that it's more like a small plate rather than an appetizer.  Also had the Big boss roll - yellowtail, tuna, salmon, salmon roe, avocado, cucumber and radish sprouts. Great execution with less, but thick pieces. 

I was a little disappointed that the sushi options were limited to tastings, specialty rolls, and a la cart nigiri/sashimi. IMO sushi restaurants should offer maki/traditional rolls. They also serve their sushi in unique plates. The chirashi came in a rectangular plate with the rice and fish separated. It was basically a sashimi platter with rice on the side. Makes sense as to why it was priced the same as the sashimi and nigiri tastings. Service was good. They were kind enough to let us stick around and chat after dinner.
author: Helen C.

description: This restaurant has a cool hip vibe right in the Haight. Fresh fresh fish and well-wrapped rolls. Great happy hour specials too! I ordered the blazing glory roll. Yum yum!
author: Erica O.

description:
This place has been approved by my sushi-snob friend from college. We both grew up in Vancouver, where the sushi is unbelievably fresh, and it's been hard to enjoy SF sushi since I moved here 10 years ago. The fish at Nara is so fresh, so full of flavor. The hotate was so delicious, as was the salmon and nigiri platter. I got a roll but I think it masked the flavor of the fish.

If you're into grilled fish and giant sushi rolls drenched in sauce, this place may not be worth the price tag for you. But if you like simple, fresh sashimi/nigiri, there are few places in this city that can match.
author: Diane W.

description: I'm a bit torn about this place. The oysters were great.  The rolls were good and of the fancy showboat variety (like one came out as a flambe). The staff was friendly. It's just not the hand built nigiri sushi experience I tend to enjoy because it's the sort of place that turns down the lights to bring out a birthday dessert with a clapping song.  But that's it, it's fun, it's not stuffy, they have flavored sakes, just get some food and clap along to the birthday at the table next to you...maybe SF needs more of this.
author: David S.

description:
Raw dishes were superb. Fish was super fresh. Fried items were well executed but nothing extraordinary. Grilled or BBQ items were delicious but ...

The biggest problem and the reason for the 1 star deduction, ingredients known to be allergens for some people were not listed on the menu or chalkboard. Nor were they mentioned by the server when we ordered. A friend who was looking forward to the Korean spiced pork ribs ended up looking on hungrily as the rest of us chowed down because the kitchen had sprinkled chopped peanuts all over the meat. Good thing we had ordered other dishes she could eat.

Restaurant was loud, hip and crowded. A place to see and be seen. Not really a place to sit back and relax. I wouldn't be opposed to a return visit but in my advancing years, I now tend to gravitate to more chill spaces.
author: Cece E.

description:
Dinner review. 

Hamachi truffle - 4/5
Spicy Karaage - 2/5
Rice poppers - 4/5
Nigiri tasting - 3/5
Fillmore - 3/5
Blazing glory - 3/5
Loco spiderman - 4/5
Heart attack - 3/5
Treasure Island - 4/5

Overall,  "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description: The food is amazing. The Shrek is to die for. The truffle hamachi is a must. The atmosphere is great - sat right down on a Friday. Food comes out quick and they don't rush you out the door. I'll def be back!
author: Darcy C.

description:
We came here for the oysters and they were out of them. Why five stars?

The friendliest servive ive seen in a while. If you were any other Restaurant, i wouldve forgotten you in a heartbeat but you made an impression. How you dare!

Anyways.. im glad to see a place that still cares, we'll be back again soon
author: Alexander S.

description: Nara is one of my favorite sushi spots! The staff is so great, the food is amazing, and the sake!! Gotta try the Jessica Alba & Sale Bomb roll!
author: Tara T.

description: Our favorite local place -- bustling and fun. We love the vibe, music, and of course the super fresh fish!!! Five stars all around
author: Camille L.

description:
These are a few of my favorite things:

- the waitress, Stephanie  She remembered my name a month and a half after I met her :')
- the tuna special (usually on Wednesday's if the tuna has a good day - I will never forget the otoro)
- the Special-K roll; my god that walu on the roll is phenomenal 
- the happy hour handrolls; it is p a c k e d with fish!! So worth.
- the tako balls!! I dream about these little potatoes 

Everything and everyone else is lovely as well, for the record :) Worth coming even if you miss happy hour!
author: Mabel T.

description: A good vibe, and great happy hour deals for $1 oysters. The oysters weren't the freshest, but still a good deal. We also got some of their rolls, sake kama, as well as sous vide octopus balls. Every item was pretty good and it was a plus that they were open on July 4th.
author: Ellin C.

description: We were exploring the city and landed here. The service was great from the start. The staff was very attentive and willing to explain the menu in depth. The menu was very simple but had a lot of things you won't find anywhere else. We started with butter for truffle and it was awesome! Highly recommend this place!
author: Natasha C.

description: We've been here 5+ times and it never disappoints! Love this place!! Good omakase at a good price! My fave is the California roll - I believe they use real crab!!
author: Nina T.

description:
Delicious omakase at a very reasonable price! ($50/$70) 

I opted for the $50 set, which came with a set of 3 raw appetizers (including the delicious hamachi truffle - one of their most popular dishes), cooked amberjack collar, nigiri/sashimi set (8 total), 6 raw oysters, and choice of dessert (green tea ice cream, creme brulee, or mochi ice cream). Everything was delicious & I was so full by the end that it was even a struggle to finish the oysters/dessert. Although I personally thought the sashimi/nigiri quality was not quite at the same level as Kusakabe, Omakase, etc., I would still highly recommend Nara's omakase for its great value!
author: Kristina W.

description: Nara was a very pleasant experience. I really enjoyed the sake and tonkatsu ramen. I will be coming back next time I am in the area. May was an excellent server. My date will definitely be getting lucky tonight bringing me here.
author: Dane R.

description: Great ambiance, friendly, informative service, and food that is tasty and nicely presented. Definitely would recommend!!
author: Neha C.

description:
Came for sushi and sake, and really enjoyed the experience. Not too crowded, even on a Friday. Snagged a table for a large group. 

We had a big group and shared everything, so got to try a lot. We tried the Haight Me (topped with uni, yum!) and a few other rolls, which were all excellent. Rolls were creative, fresh, and moderately priced. Though it was a bit small to share, the black cod was great, and the crispy rice it came with possibly better than the cod itself. Of the appetizers, hamachi truffle was good, but maguro tar tar was forgettable. Oysters were fresh and delicious.

Overall, good, affordably priced meal. We ordered a few house sake carafes and large beers to share, and total including food and drink came out to about $40 per person including tax and tip. Ambience is casual, but nice. Would definitely return!
author: Kavita S.

description:
The baking starters are amazing - one of the best I've had in town.  The ankimo itself has the perfect consistency and texture.  The oyster shooters as well were amazingly good with suitable pairing sauces.  
PS.  May was our server and she was the best, went above and beyond to make sure we had the perfect experience!
author: Timothy L.

description:
Nice addition to the Lower Haight neighborhood! By its name "Sake Bar" it should be expected that this is not any traditional izakaya joint - and once you step inside you would totally feel it. Very loud, very hip, vibrant atmosphere; in fact I think the music could have been turned down a bit because I could barely listen to my friend's chatting during the dinner. But anyway, I was very impressed by the food.

Marinated Fried Eggplant: B+.
Not bad. The eggplant was marinated very well, it has a deep flavor within it. It was only slightly fried which added a sense of crispiness outside of the eggplant.

Hamachi Truffle: A-.
Very nicely presented. Strong truffle taste. Even though this is kind of a carpaccio dish but I could still taste the hamachi freshness. 

Nigiri Tasting: A.
This was a total surprise. I wouldn't have expected such fresh fish in a sake bar restaurant! There were 7pcs, and although the waitress did present what each of those fish was it was too loud that I could hardly hear. All I know is that it was really fresh. This made me believe that the place was actually created with a traditional + hipster fusion Japanese restaurant theme. Order this. You won't be disappointed.

Heart Attack Roll: A-.
The main fish was spicy tuna, with some cucumber and topped with toro and some type of chips. Both kinds of fish tasted very nice, the chips were interesting, overall a very good choice in my opinion.

So yea, good food, great service. Ordered 4 glasses of beer for my friend and myself, turned out to be ~$57+tips per person. Considered the great quality of food I think this was not a bad price at all. Definitely a place to come back especially with a bigger group of friends. If the music can be turned down a little bit when I go next time I will doubtlessly give it a 5-star!
author: Simon C.

description:
Stumbled across this place while exploring the Lower Haight and on my way over to check out Ricky Bobby. I'm so glad the decor here caught my eye because I loved everything I put in my mouth here!

We ordered the tempora appetizer, sake bomb roll, big boss roll, and some nigiris. I was very happy with the quality of food and how delicious everything is. Pricing is very fair, especially for this neighborhood and I was happy with the portions we received.

I happen to be cutting out alcohol at the moment but I loved their ample selection of sake and very affordable sampler options. This place would be perfect for a small group of friends to split a huge sake bottle for a chill night.

I love how this place is right across from an awesome bar, Noc Noc, which makes this the perfect dinner and pregame stop for the night.

This is definitely my new go-to stop and default sushi restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: May is a great server!! Food is high quality and service is very fast. The vibe of Nara is a hip one, and my date was very satisfied after a night at Nara. Thank you Nara.
author: Jamison H.

description:
I was a bit skeptical about this place due to the mix reviews I had read, but decided to try it with a group of friends for dinner on a Saturday.

Without reservations, you usually have to wait specially if you're coming with a big group, but we ended up waiting only 30 minutes. The bright side of this is that Nara is located in a street full of bars and restaurants and is super easy to find a spot to get a drink in the meantime.

We ordered different rolls, all very good. The Ramen wasn't fantastic, but their signature Hamachi Truffle crudo with jalapeño is out of this world. A must try.

The bill wasn't expensive for what we are getting used to in the city, and the service pretty good. I definitely recommend this place, good for either a date night or group dinner.
author: Marta V.

description: Great specials that change with what is most fresh. Come for the oysters 5-7! Cool vibe
author: Erin C.

description:
Dope ass happy hour. Here for the first time, hope they got oysters on rotation.
I had a salmon hand roll and it was good! 
My friend got some tacos and she enjoyed them also. 
Good service and pretty cool setup. The atmosphere is fitting for a sushi bar.
I'll come here again!
author: Dragon L.

description: We ordered few rolls and it was all very delicious. They had one role where it came out it fire. It was impressive. This place was open til 11:30pm so it was perfect for hungry people at the late night. They also had good selection of sake.
author: Mini K.

description: Love this place. Has super unconventional rolls that are really interesting and delicious. Vibe is really young and atmosphere is really great. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Connor M.

description: Great sushi spot! We loved the rice poppers and the big boss roll. The chicken karaage, salmon kama, special k roll, and happy hour tacos were also delicious!
author: Britta J.

description: Places like this remind you whats really important in life: family, friends, and good sushi. I drink 4-5 bottles of sake each time I'm here.
author: Umber S.

description:
This place offers nice food with decent price in a okay atmosphere. If you don't expect the best Japanese food, you would be satisfied.

Some of rolls are different from typical one in other place. We had one roll aluminum foiled and cooked in table with burning material. though it was interesting, its taste was not that impressive.
author: Sangwhan M.

description: Friendly service, hipster atmosphere, creative sushi rolls. We ordered the sake bomb, loco spiderman roll,  3 pieces of sake, tonkotsu ramen, miyabi oysters, and spicy salmon roll. My favorite was the Miyabi oysters. They're definitely a good deal during happy hour for only $1.50 each! Super fresh and tasty. I expected more from the sushi rolls but was disappointed :(
author: Sophie L.

description:
I love this place!  The food here is as high-quality as the atmosphere is laid-back.  I like how the restaurant is mostly dark, but the menu board is neon and carefree.  The chefs and servers seem really cool.  
____________________
-The hamachi with truffle spoons were a nice start.  Each spoon is like a little soup.  They're quite salty though.   

-The raw oysters are so fresh!

-The mushroom tempura and agedashi tofu are both delicate, warm, and umami 

- The Onikoroshi "demon slayer" sake is like no other sake I've had.  It doesn't even taste like alcohol: just essence of watermelon.  I don't like the taste of alcohol, but I could drink this any time.  The flavor made me believe it can really slay demons!

- The roll (I don't remember what it was called) was good, but I wouldn't get it again, because the sashimi here is so great on its own that it doesn't need to be hidden.

- The uni is the best I've ever had.  In my experience, every uni has its own flavor profile.  The uni here has a non-stop creamy flavor and mouthfeel.  It lingers in the best way possible. 

- The Otoro was very good.  It wasn't as melt-in-your-mouth as I'd hoped, but more like a fish steak.  The flavor was very clean and piquant.  

- The hamachi sashimi is lovely and simple.  

- I did not try the unagi or wagyu sashimi, but i was told the unagi is great, and the wagyu is otherworldly.  
__________

The chefs even gave us complimentary salmon sashimi (which was delicious), sake, and a birthday dessert!  The attention to detail is touching.  I'll definitely come back.
author: Virgo A.

description:
Hands down for this place !!
I was in the neighborhood with friends and wanted to try this place ! 

Great atmosphere as I walked in and friendly greeting ! 

We ordered hamachi truffle ( a must ) 
Chef nigiri tasting ( each piece seasoned perfectly ) 
Ray ray's tako ( a must too)

And our server was very nice and attentive !!

My friends and I had a great experience here
We will definitely come back for more !!
author: Jeong Hwan O.

description:
this place was much larger than expected for being a neighborhood spot - lots of 2- and 4- tops plus communal high tops, and a bar area.  i've been wanting to explore the haight more, so was happy to find this spot on yelp with such great reviews!  came in with a gf at 6:30 on a wednesday and were seated immediately. the servers are very efficient with bringing menus and water. they have happy hour til 7 which is fantastic so i got 2 large carafes of hot sake for $5 each. a steal! 

we're sushi fanatics, so we ordered way too much food - 1 each of the nigiri sampler (7 pieces), 1 each of the handroll sampler (3 rolls), 1 of the sashimi sampler (7 pieces), the big boss roll (5 pieces) and an order of pork belly. ALL FOR TWO PEOPLE, it was a ridiculous amount of food, but we obvs ate it all... i would definitely skip the pork belly (texture like karaage, not like cooked for hours yummy pork belly at all) and maki roll next time - not impressed at all.  the fish was pretty good..a few pieces were even melt in your mouth (escolar! yum!). bill came out to be $144 with tax for the two of us - a steal for sf.  plus now we know what to skip next time!
author: Christina L.

description: The oyster shooter were good and who can pass up Happy Hour....  Last time I came it was good second time seem just as good. I would recommend it if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Daniel V.

description: My favorite sushi place in San Francisco so far! Wow, what a great experience and value. The ambiance is modern yet relaxed, with wood tones throughout. Service is peppy and welcoming, love it. We had edamame, three rolls (Loco Spider Roll, Heart Attack, and Big Boss) and the tea. All were excellent. Love the Loco Spider roll especially (such crispy battered crab). Prices were very fair. Hope to be back!!
author: Mikey J.

description:
There are no words to describe this sushi
So fresh and so rich ! Just perfect !

All of the fish melts in your mouth like butter 
Perfect temperature 
SEAT AT THE BAR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

We came for dinner at 7 on Monday and were immediately seated 


Recommend : hamachi truffle , nigiri tasting , sake kama, Saba ! Omg their Saba ! Torched and freshly grounded ginger and a yuzu drop ? Can eat everyday !!

People !! What are you waiting for ?
author: Amy H.

description: Nara is open late and the service is friendly. Nice open feel lots of windows and high ceilings with a nice sushi bar.
author: Ryan I.

description: This is my first time at Nara for happy hour and I have to say, it's fantastic. The menu is small, but I personally like small menus. To me, it means that everything they offer is amazing and believe me, it was! We ordered handrolls, shrimp tacos, takoyaki, rice poppers, and oysters and everything was delicious. To add on, the service was on point. Our servers were super nice and attentive and made us feel welcome. Thumbs up, Nara! We'll be coming again!
author: Rachelle S.

description: Came here with my family, nice quaint atmosphere. Tried the spicy salmon and spicy tuna handrolls. Handrolls were spot on, but the Wagyu nigiri was the highlight of the dinner. Buttery, melt in your mouth beef. The owner came by and gave us some grade A sake on the house. He didn't have to do that, but the fact that we shared stories together and drank together became the highlight of the night. This is one of the best restaurants I had the pleasure of eating at and would recommend this spot to any lovers of fine Japanese cuisine.
author: Jonathan N.

description:
Nice little Japanese place that recently opened. We ordered the maguro tar tar appetizer, Big Boss, Sake Bomb, Heart Attack and Garden Nara.

The appetizer was by far the best. 6 pieces, solid 5 stars. The display was simple and beautiful, and the fatty tuna went really well with the asian pear, radish, and avocado.

The Heart attack was also really good. I think this one was the one that had fried lotus roots on top. Twas delicious. Big Boss and Sake bomb was pretty good, too - but didn't stand out as much. 

I would not recommend the Garden Nara. It was not what I expectedly. Probably pretty healthy since it has no rice around it, but tasted like a mini veggie wrap and the taste/ texture did not go well with anything else. 

We were still a bit hungry after 5 rolls because we are fatsos, so we ordered the seafood pancake which was pretty good. Not amazing though and the portion was kinda small.

Overall, my experience was great and I would totally go here again. One thing that was a bit odd was the music. Just a tad strange to be chewing on some raw fish with Beyonce's 7/11 on - but no complaints. Great pop dance music sushi shop. I'd recommend turning it into a dance club after 10p.
author: Juliana P.

description: Great swanky sushi spot in the Haight. Nice interior. We got here around 6pm and there was no wait so we immediately got to ordering and eating! The happy hour items are pretty good, $1.50 oysters or $5 hand rolls any time from 5-7 pm. I got the spicy tuna handroll for the happy hour and the sake bomb roll. Both were good! The oysters were fresh as well. Also make sure to ask about special menu items as they have new ones daily and you don't want to miss out on those
author: Eugene O.

description:
I have been coming here ever since they opened
And I am writing this for future customers

They have happy hour for a dollar oyster (fresh ) , draft beers , and hot sake everyday !
During week they don't get too crazy till 7 pm

Their sashimi and Nigiri tasting are a must (it's not cheap but it's worthy if you know sushi )

Please don't come here if you are trying to get a lot of stuff but you don't understand why they are a little expensive 
There are plenty of places that you could get less expensive sushi !

We love it here and we will bring friends and family :)
author: Seungho L.

description:
Food: 1/5
Service: 3/5
Atmosphere: 4/5

I really don't understand how a restaurant like this can have an overall 4.5 stars rating. We ordered some a la carte nigiri (sake, hon maguro, unagi, amaebi, hotate, uni, and ika) and two rolls, Haight Me and Sake Bomb.

Let me just tell you, I've NEVER had sushi this SALTY in my life. I don't understand how the seasoning can be this off. I think it could be that they marinate their fish such as sake and ika in salt, but the over-saltiness wasn't just in the fish. The main problem was the seasoning in their rice. It almost tasted like someone accidentally poured a bucket of salt in the rice or something.

The second problem was that all the ingredients were NOT FRESH. Their uni was probably the worst uni I've put in my mouth, it had such weird flavor and bitter taste. It takes a lot for an uni fanatic like me to leave a piece of uni nigiri on the table. It was that bad! Not to mention all of their other fish were meh. They really didn't taste fresh at all.

The third problem was that the flavors were quite off in the rolls. It could be the over-seasoning of the rice, stale ingredients, their sauces, or the combination of everything, but I just couldn't eat all of them even though I was at the restaurant with a huge craving of sushi and appetite.

I really wanted to like this place, the Korean staff are nice and the atmosphere is quite nice, too. I think the quality of food is the most important factor in a restaurant, though, and for that reason, this restaurant gets the lowest possible rating I could give and I will never be back here.
author: Annie L.

description: A great place on Haight, that isn't too hippy. The food is delicious and they had great halloween decorations up. Easy to get s table during weekdays.
author: Ray J.

description:
I am so, so perplexed at the positive reviews.

This was gross. Fish is not fresh enough. I was, and still am, disgusted even just thinking about the meal. Don't come here.
author: J. A.

description:
Pretty good sushi and sake spot on Heights. Came on a Friday night with no wait.  Good selection of nigiri, sashimi, rolls, specials, and izakaya dishes.  There was a bacon wrapped enoki mushroom that caught my eye, but it was $8 for 2 sticks.  So we opted for the $16 hand roll sampler (toro, bin toro, and sake). Good, but nothing impressive. Just wanted good food in our bellies before we pregammed ;) 

Also got the Escolar Salsa (seared butter fish, pico de gallo salsa, lotus chip) - 4 stars.  Had great taste but needed a bigger kick to be 5 stars. 

Hot sake was $6 for about 6-7 shots. 

Atmosphere - fun, hipster, played r&b oldies that you can sing along to.  Not crowded, so I really liked it. 

OVERALL - Sure, I would come back and try their other dishes.
author: Raquel Y.

description:
Good happy hour vibe. Came here for dinner on a Thursday night and there was no wait in line, but the place was almost filled up. There is bar seating and tables, and it's dimly lit. A tv showing the Giants game was airing in the background. 

Friend and I ordered two nigiri tastings, a handroll tasting, and the Jessica Alba roll (shrimp tempura topped with albacore.) The handroll tasting was delicious! I loved the toro one. Fish felt fresh and flavorful. The nigiri tasting was good but didn't blow me away. A couple of the pieces had a bit too much wasabi for my liking. It did not look as fancy as some of the pics I saw on yelp. 

Overall I enjoyed my experience here. Quality sushi, lively atmosphere, and good service. Too bad I came too late for the happy hour deals, but $1 oyster sure sounds good.
author: Christina G.

description: Great atmosphere with a very cool vibe, a creative menu and wonderful customer service!
author: Kristin O.

description:
Spicy Tuna  +++

Blazing Glory Roll +++

Spicy Chicken Karaage +++


Glad we went here.
author: Brian V.

description: Really nice place with a cool vibe! Food is great I got the sake bomb roll and it was yummy!
author: Magola A.

description: This place was lit fam. Outrageously lit. I'm calling my boy who's calling his girl who's calling his mans and we're coming through every weekend .
author: Dylan R.

description:
9/10 would def recommend!

We all started with their tacos and hand rolls at the happy hour prices! Whoosh such value! The house salad is over-dressed but a tasty treat. 

Shorty Krause was tender, well-seasoned and a perfect plate to share! The salmon shoulder was a special treat, imperfect if you are taking a date but a delicious pairing with the house sauce.

As far as a sushi joint, the Jessica Alba and Big boy rolls were delish!

May was the best server I have had the pleasure to meet and will definitely ask when I return soon
author: Paul H.

description: Great decor and excellent sushi. I went with my girlfriend at 6:30pm and had no problem. We got Special K and Sake Bomb rolls and found them to be tasty, serendipitous, and flavorful. The cuisine had a non-lackadaisical energy that enthralled my taste buds. My girlfriend found the experience both exemplary, ephemeral, and a night to savor.
author: Shana C.

description: Korean owned and operated. Very friendly staff. Mid-tier sushi and sashimi but prices are also not as high as the fancier establishments in the FD. John definitely puts his energy and creativity to his omakase.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Sushi is average. Over the top rolls with a lot of flash, but still tasty.  Fun vibe and there aren't enough servers to be give good service, but they do try.  I would not go out of my  way to eat here, but as a neighborhood joint in walkable distance, I come here 1x/month.
author: Bay Girl N.

description: The food is pretty good here, but the acoustics inside need improvement.  It is extremely loud, and simple noise absorbing materials or art work could be hung from the walls or ceiling to address this.  Also, the employees yell a greeting and a goodbye as customers enter and exit the restaurant. This is quite jarring for people eating and should be stopped.  I realize it might be a Japanese custom to do this, but yelling all the time makes for a very uncomfortable and unenjoyable dining experience.
author: Lily A.

description:
Inattentive service (no one super rude, just not very helpful), grimey interior, dirty feeling unpleasant, mediocre food. Short review but not much more to say.

It was perfectly forgettable. Too bad my experience seems different than others. Wanted to like this place.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Solid place with a hipster touch! You have to go here just for the sushi with the pop rocks...a little shock doesn't hurt anyone. It has a darker ambiance with a party vibe to it a lot of people are sake bombing and great staff. The staff are very friendly they scream something every time enters and leaves the restaurant. The Big Boss is everyone's favorite it has : Yellowtail, tuna, salmon, salmon roe, avocado, cucumber and radish sprouts and a very clean and delicious taste to it. The hamachi truffle is to die for with yellowtail with jalapeno and to top it off with some truffle oil.

The Haight is a great neighborhood with a lot of SF culture and this is a great spot to check out in the area.
author: Kunal T.

description:
Great! We arrived without reservations and they found us a spot right away. 

New favorite roll in SF - Special K . Freaking delicious. Somewhat loud so if you can go earlier rather than later, probably better. Wish they had more roll variety but I haven't tried everything so maybe they're all awesome!
author: Brittney B.

description:
Overall 3 stars for the great service, fun vibe, and a few tasty dishes (it's tapas style). Just make sure to get the right dishes. I would come back with a big group of friends and get all the plates and drinks that sound good. A sampling below. 

Ranked in order of deliciousness:
1) Hamachi truffle: seared yellowtail with jalapeño cilantro and crunch in truffle oil ponzu. It comes in 5 delectable spoons with all the seasonings. You can taste the truffle without it being overpowering. Would get again. 

2) (Special on wall) Ray-Ray's Tako - sous vide Spanish octopus with red wine and apple reduction. Cooked just right for chewy texture and a nice sweet-savory glaze. 

3) Rice poppers: 4 deep fried sushi rice topped with spicy tuna and white tuna and ranch dressing. It's like a bite-sized Japanese rice ball. Yum. 

4) Garlic butter edamame: you just can't go wrong with garlic and butter. Get it. 

4) Big boss: yellowtail, tuna, salmon, ikura, avocado, cucumber, radish sprouts. I like it that it's just fish and rice, no fancy toppings needed. The ikura makes this roll.

Below this - would not get again: 

5) Spicy tonkotsu ramen: it's not entirely fair to compare this to ramen-only shops, but this was a real miss. The spiciness overpowered the broth so you couldn't taste the pork flavor. Noodles were stuck together, e.g. what happens when you cook pasta and leave it out to dry w/ no oil. The yolk in the egg seemed al dente but somewhere along the way it fell out of the egg white and was never found again...so can't really comment on that one. 

6) Spicy handroll tasting: you get one of each spicy tuna, hamachi and sake. Nothing special. 

If I'm in the area again I'll come back to try  the other dishes.

Atmosphere: it's a fun izakaya / gastropub vibe and it's open late (til 1130p), which is awesome and so rare in SF! 

Service: super super fast - we were here at 1030p on a Saturday night and the place was about 1/3 full.
author: Inga C.

description:
Most of the stars I give are to the service. Our waitress, Yumi, was a delight! She was very polite and attentive to our party of 8, and did us a small but very sweet favor ;) (she knows). I'm happy that there's still servers like Yumi around.

The food was pretty good too. Not life-changing but not bad. Tip if you're going to order the Chirashi: it's actually quite small for $25. It comes on a huge plate but there's maybe 5-6 pieces of sashimi and the rest is rice and other garnishes. Nobody was really full after this, so I'd suggest it for a light dinner, not when you're hungry.

The decor and atmosphere was also nice, very trendy and San Francisco. The place isn't very big but it'll accommodate large parties with a reservation.
author: Hai H.

description: WE LOVE ZOEY SHE'S THE BEST!!!!!! But really, she was so nice and helpful. Sushi's great and happy hour is until 7.
author: K S.

description: Nice place! The staff were super friendly, and the atmosphere was nice. Prices seemed fair. The quality of the food was good. I had the sashimi tasting menu and liked it. The fish tasted really clean and simple, very fresh! Mostly I liked the staff who were so attentive--it was a lovely experience thanks to them.
author: Joni W.

description:
We ordered the chirashi and ramen. The freshness and cut of the sashimi was pretty good. However, the portions are extremely small. The sushi rice was also very dry and unseasoned.

What bothered me most was the service. My chirashi came first and my boyfriends ramen came way later. So the whole time we were just watching each other eat...
author: Betty T.

description:
I had a unique yet very refreshing experience here. Came in on a rainy day and as soon as we walk in the staff greets us in unison. Now I didn't understand what they said... But I'm sure it was some form of saying "Welcome" but of course in Japanese. We get seated, the ambience is nice. I thought the interior was nice even from the outside. Inside its dark, wooden tables which create a rustic vibe, but the rest of the restaurant looks modern, Very neat and spaced out. Another thing I noticed was the music that was playing. For me, it really set the scene for a great dinner. The playlist was creative and entertaining. Now I'm a fan of hip hop, rnb, edm... And it was a mixture of all, and appropriate of course. It's something different and the choice of music was great because it doesn't always work when you have an employee picking the playlist. 

Anyways as for the food, we had a couple rolls and appetizers. The wait wasn't long at all and the waitress was helpful. The rolls we tried were...

*Heart Attack - a lot of finesse on this dish. The tuna looked fresh, no doubting the quality. The garnish was impressive, and the roll was delicious. 

*Loco Spider Roll - Huge, I'm always a fan of multiple fish assortments in a roll. Soft shell crab was crispy, almost like getting a appetizer on top of the roll. 

*Treasure Roll - Deep fried and cream cheese is always a killer combo. They used real crab meat on which I appreciate instead of imitation. And the fresh tuna packed inside for the perfect size roll. 

Food now isn't just all about taste, it's also about presentation. People say you eat with your eyes, and eating here, I wasn't sure if it was my eyes or my stomach that was more satisfied. I feel like the chefs here understand how complex the elements of food. It's an Art, it's takes finesse, but it's also a science and understanding what works well together. It's very hard to paint a picture on a plate and even harder to make it taste good at the same time. It's very easy to mess that up. Complements to the chefs here because they got it done. I was also able to speak to the one  managers and he was very genuine and he appreciated our feedback. As for the whole dinning experience as a whole, it was a perfect night. I still can't get over the music selection. The food was phenomenal, service exceptional, and the prices are fair. The combination of all of the things above put this restaurant as one of my top sushi favorites!
author: Arron E.

description:
The decor is very modern and comfortable, and the service is even better. Nara is one of my favorite Japanese-style joints in SF because of its well-roundedness :)

We sat at the bar and all of the sushi chefs genuinely looked happy to be there. I enjoyed everything we ordered and thought the prices were perfect. We ordered the House warm sake (highly recommend), Heart Attack Roll, It's Like Butter Baby Cod, 2 pieces of sake (raw salmon), tempura, and ginger creme brulee / avocado chocolate mousse. The Heart Attack was pretty spicy and was just okay. The cod was my absolute favorite dish of the night, it was perfectly cooked and oh-so-flakey. Just the way cod should be. The raw salmon was pretty fresh but not the best I've had. The tempura was great - highly recommend as an appetizer to share. The desserts were 3 stars, nothing very complex to make and not a must have. The ginger creme brulee barely had any ginger taste, and the avocado chocolate mousse was a bit hard - should be much creamier especially when using avocado.

All in all, I would recommend Nara in a heartbeat to anyone looking for good Japanese food! I will definitely be a regular here.
author: Claudia C.

description: It's good sushi. Not great sushi, but solid. I'd give it a B/B+. If you have a large group and want reliable food where no one will say "this is terrible", Nara will fit the bill. If you want out-of-this-world sushi, look elsewhere.
author: Devin G.

description:
Time and time again this place delivers!
Great selection of yummy dishes.
Don't miss out on the Hamachi truffle and butterfish! So good my mouth is drooling.
author: Ofer G.

description: Was walking around and went in after seeing $1.50 oysters and happy hour beers. Can't go wrong with a cold sapporo and oysters were pretty good. Place was pretty empty but it was around 5pm. Might try this out for a dinner thing some time!
author: Ringo S.

description: Every time I come here I think "I need to come here more." The sake list is great, the happy hour deals are fantastic, they have walu (which I love), and every special roll is super unique and delicious. And the presentation is truly spectacular, particularly given that it's not super expensive. Anyway, come here. You'll be very happy and also not poor.
author: Alison S.

description:
I usually never write reviews on Yelp but I had to do it this time...

Hands down the best sushi ever!!!

We were a party of 5, arriving w/o reservations on a sunday night and we got sat down pretty quickly.

All the servers were super friendly, service was quick, and the FOOD!!!!

Food is AMAZING here!

We order a sashimi plate, whole order of Saba sashimi, and O-Toro Nigiris

It wasnt the cheapest but definetely worth every dollar!

This is my new favorite restaurant now!!!!
author: James G.

description: First time here! Empty on a Sunday night because of outside lands so win for us! Service is wonderful! And the sushi is just amazing. Beautiful plating paired well with hot sake
author: Kimberly L.

description: Service was awesome! Our server, Yumi, was very attentive and helpful. She made sure our table was clean and cleared at all times. The food was to die for! The happy hour shrimp guac tacos and the hamachi truffle were bomb!!! I think we ordered 12 shrimp guac tacos and a dozen of the oysters! The oysters were as fresh as I expected!!! Better hit this spot for happy hour! We had maybe 5 bottles. The Kikusui and Sawa Sawa were amazing together with the hot sake and Sapporo Black. We've never had hot sake as good as this one! I'm pretty sure they don't microwave it in here!    This is the best restaurant to go to after work because they make you feel so relaxed and taken care of. Thank you for making our experience enjoyable! We will be definitely be back again!
author: Ellise F.

description: The sushi is delicious and the staff are really kind, special shoutout to Stephanie. Love this neighborhood spot, good vibes.
author: Samantha P.

description:
I wish I could give this place 5 stars but the service wasn't so great so had to deduct a star. 

The sushi is amazing. So creative, fresh, and beautifully presented. The vibe of this place is great as well. 

The nigiri and sashimi tastings were excellent. The butterfish tasting was mind blowing. The handroll tasting was good but not the best. The heart attack and treasure island rolls were delicious. 

Everything is so well presented and I was pleasantly surprised by how fresh the fish was. 

My new favorite place. If only the servers start paying more attention and not leave us waiting next time.
author: Shireen J.

description:
Love the ambiance - modern feel with wooden decor and sake bottles to complete the look, location is great and service is always super friendly! We came on a Friday night and got seated quickly, it's almost Christmas time so everyone was wearing fun Santa hats and reindeer ears, and the Christmas music was great! It was someone's birthday in the restaurant, and how they celebrate is turning the lights down, and putting this fun rap music on and bringing out dessert! It's super fun and everyone in the restaurant got into it. 

I love the "Blazing Glory" role, it comes wrapped in aluminum foil, with a thin line of fire on the side! It burns down by itself and then someone comes back to unwrap it. Love the presentation and the roll itself was delicious.
author: Amber L.

description: We live in the area and just found this place.  Very creative presentation and good energy. Good showmanship.
author: Hans G.

description:
Thank God, this is just what the lower Haight needed (and good riddance to Sushi 509 right across the street by the way!).

Their rolls are creative, packed with flavor, perfectly made, and FRESH! And they aren't drowned in spicy mayo or eel sauces - they get their unique flavors from pairing fish that perfectly complement each other together, wrapping them in perfectly made rice and high quality seaweed, and adding shiso leaves, seaweed salad, daikon sprouts, roe, even UNI to the top! 

Not to mention, they have $1 Miyagi oysters during happy hour, plus beer and sake specials, They have a great sake menu, including a sparkling option - so good! The service is always friendly, and the chefs are excited to welcome their customers. I think word of mouth has been spreading because as the months have gone on since this place opened a few months ago, it has gotten progressively more and more crowded.
author: Jessica C.

description:
What a menu with many of my favorite things. When we arrived early in the evening there was no wait that was a great start. Being it's a holiday weekend most of the restaurants  were very crowded and this is worth it for the taxi ride to the Haight.
 The menu was put varied ranging in Specialities for hard core sushi enthusiast as well as those dabbling in Japanese cuisine.  What I ordered bacon skewers with inoiki mushrooms- butterfish addiction appetizer- oysters- lychee saki.  What I loved- the boyfriend hamachi truffle appetizer - the ginger creme brulee. What I would get next time - the grilled miso butterfish . I plan to edit this review later--
author: stacie s.

description: This place is without a doubt a favorite when it comes to sushi in SF. Fish here is very fresh and the nigiri tastings have never let me down. The staff here is excellent, service is very friendly and neighborly. Their rolls are unique and are worth experimenting on. Get in here now!
author: Tyler G.

description:
Love the clean and sleek look of Nara. 
Came here on a Saturday night around 7 without reservations and was seated immediately at the sushi bar.
The staff is very attentive and the service is very good. 
I got the big boss roll (~$12) and it came out almost right away.
I love this place! Very affordable, great service, and quality of food
author: Norah C.

description: This was a terrible dining experience. The sushi rolls they have are overly complicated gimmicky roles that don't showcase the fish at all. One roll was topped with tuna that tasted fishy and off to us. They refused to remove it from the bill and made us order a replacement roll that we didn't want instead. Then the credit card machine wasn't working so we had to write down our card info and leave it behind. Sketchy. The waitress was nice but we will never be back. Terrible food and not customer centric
author: Ella M.

description: What a great experience. The food is amazing-- clam miso, jalapeño popper roll, everything! We made a reservation beforehand and they were able to accommodate 10 people no problem. Perfect for a night of sushi and sake with friends. Stephanie's service went above and beyond what's expected.
author: Megan Q.

description:
$1 for an oyster, it's fresh & delicious. Some oysters are a bit too small, but still worthy! $2 for a hot roasted rice tea. The cup's brand is DavidsTea. I though it may cost more than $5. I suggest that everyone should order hot tea there! It contains zero calories and is healthy. 

We ordered Spider-Man Rolls. It contains tuna, soft shell cars and spicy mayo. It's so crunchy! Ramen soup is nice, but I don't have much comment on it.
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
Very solid sushi joint!  The ambience is very modern and sleek.  The sushi chefs and wait staff yell out in Japanese as a welcome when you walk in the door (kind of funny and cool at the same time), and the wait staff was very quick to seat us as we walked in.  I was very sad to see that we had missed happy hour oysters by just a few minutes, so I'll have to stop by again for that next time! The food we had here was very good.  Some of the more memorable dishes we had were Ray Ray's Tako and grilled Pork Belly dish.  Ray Ray's Tako had an amazing sauce that complimented the tako very well.  The grilled pork belly was rich, not overcooked, and came with 3 huge pieces. :D I've  also tried the 7 pc nigiri sampler and the hotate sliders.  The nigiri sampler was good, quality of the fish was good, but not the best I've had.  I would still order the nigiri sampler again. The hotate sliders were really good as well!  The rolls here are decent, but none of the ones we had were very memorable.  

Service was solid!
author: Kay A.

description: Such a great spot for sushi and happy hour...and sake!!! Thanks, May, for the exceptional customer service! We will be back!
author: Karen H.

description:
Sake Bomb: Very good, no jalapeno as noted, must remember to request without the tobiko. (little fish eggs)
Treasure Island: Good, except it was supposed to have jalapeno and either they forgot or didn't have them because there was no spice whatsoever on these.
Garlic Butter Edamame: IMO, best part of the meal.
Miso: sub-par. It was tepid and seemed to be separating, which means it was old and almost ruined the meal for me. If the miso isn't good, the rest is questionable. 
Overall I did go late in the evening right before close so everyone must have been eager to leave and they skimped on quality. The waitress was not very friendly and bordered on rude.
author: Marcela M.

description: Nara was phenomenal. We came in from out of town hearing great things, it did not disappoint. The edamame and jalapeño poppers were terrific appetizers, and the Shrek was to die for. As far as the Sushi , terrific as well.  Great customer service and atmosphere!
author: Ryan K.

description: Wonderful sushi!  Fresh fish, excellent other dishes to choose from and excellent, attentive service.  The tuna/maguro, however, was poorly sliced.  It had tough sinews in it, so difficult to bit into.  Don't think that should be the case with good sushi cutting....
author: Maureen O.

description: The have wonderful service and wide variety of sake. Everything on the menu is reasonably priced. Parking isn't that great but I'd definitely come here again. Eddy offered us a small plate of smelt on the house. It was amazing! Definitely recommend!
author: Jasmin N.

description: I went on a double date here as we were all in the mood for some sushi. This place is not your average sushi place and I feel like you have to be somewhat of a sushi expert to be able to find something that you like here. I am not sushi connoisseur so I did not get much out of this experience as others might have. I am a lover of the California roll, basic, plain and simple and there was nothing even remotely close to this on the menu. There was a flaming sushi roll on the menu that we got and it literally comes to your table, on a plate that is then lit by your server and it flames for a few minutes. Apparently that is not only for your entertainment, but that cooks the roll of sushi on the plate. If you really like sushi and are up for trying new varieties of it, this is your place to be.
author: Lex D.

description: Overpriced mediocre sushi. Unfortunately, I had higher expectations after reading the reviews but left paying $50 for two rolls that tasted just okay. I know it was a busier night but my friend and I felt rushed the entire time we were there. After finishing our meal the waitress came up to us asking if we wanted anything else, little did we know she already printed out the checkout receipt and was ready to give it to us. Even though we would have loved to order dessert & tea, felt like we had to leave. Won't be coming back.
author: Ivana M.

description: Restaurant has a nice design, décor. Food not really my cup of tea, we had the pork belly, some of the rolls and salmon. Guess this place caters to more adventurous eaters. Have had food poisoning from bad sushi, sashimi a few times I personally only eat cooked rolls.  The service was however top notch, just could not rate it higher as I was not a fan of the food.
author: Beth P.

description: the service here is incredible. everyone is especially kind here and pay extra attention to detail so even though your food might take a bit longer to arrive but the presentation is worth it!
author: Siara J.

description:
The shrimp tacos during happy hour are probably my favorite thing ever. Order hella. 

Also all the sake choices are a little intimidating but, after pointing fairly randomly, I'm fairly tipsy and having a great time!
author: Forrest Z.

description: We ordered the miyagi oysters, jalapeño poppers and the Omakase. Everything was fresh and absolutely delicious. Chef and waitress were friendly and attentive. Will be going back. 5/5!
author: Henry W.

description: Busy and popular! Good, fresh sushi, decent prices and original combinations.
author: Tim B.

description: Wow wow wow! I wish I can give this restaurant 10 starts instead of 5. First of all their staff is super friendly! They welcomed us to our table and helped us a lot with the menu. We ordered 2 appetizers, rolls and the 10 piece omakase. Everything was presented perfectly and the fish tasted extremely fresh and good! I'll be coming back for more! Well done!
author: Roba Z.

description: Delish omakase. 5/5 will come back again soon! Great food and staff. All of the fish was very fresh. The beer was crisp and the sake kept on flowing! Yum!!
author: Matheus K.

description: Nara is a great place to come with big groups, whether it's for happy hour or just a meal. They have a great variety of food, from traditional sushi rolls to more Korean fusion steam buns. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of fish - one of my favorites is the Big Boss Roll which mixes yellowtail, tuna, and salmon that is then paired with sprouts, avocado and cucumber. If you want something heartier, their ramen is decent and they also offer an array of specials, from wagyu steak to hamachi kama. Nara is the place to go for fun vibes, creative food, and maybe a sake bomb or two!
author: Ashley T.

description:
Yes!! 

Finally a good Japanese restaurant that is not overpriced and in a 10mn walking distance from my place. 

Good rolls, good grilled fish, nice service, nice decor and atmosphere. 

Will def be back.
author: Margaux M.

description: So I came I in with my wife for the happy hour from 5pm-7pm. Parking is a bit tricky to find but it shouldn't take more than 10mins. If you end up parking in the surrounding neighborhoods you have a two hour limit which ends at 9pm. Now to the restaurant. Our server Yumi was amazing! Her and her staff were very attentive. The vibe is definitely a fusion-y, hipster spot in the Haight, but we felt right at home. We tried a few drinks and food while we were here. They had a good selection of sake so have fun and try new drinks. When it comes to the food we really enjoyed the guacamole shrimp tacos which was part of the happy and the hamachi truffle. The latter wasn't part of the happy hour was definitely worth a try. You will definitely won't be disappointed with this spot!
author: Maurice C.

description:
Nice & Fresh Foods.
Beautiful plating.
Modern and natural interior.

Getting better and better. 
Definatly, I will be a patron of this place.
author: Jay L.

description:
irassshyaimaseeeee!

(^_^) Cali POPratatatPOP
Start with straight rolls and then Pop Rockles.
Start with straight rolls and then Pop Rockles.

author: Dan B.

description:
This place has a very welcoming environment, and the people behind the counter, adding the value of the people attending you, gives such a positive energy, I would come back anytime.
A had a Ramen Soup as good as the best I have had in the past. Highly recommended!!
author: Rolando R.

description: I can't tell. Maybe I got all the wrong things. But it isn't that good and things look nothing as fresh as the photos. Not sure. I wasn't impressed at all and it's not a 4 star place.
author: P L.

description: Bad, bad, this is so bad. The 1.5 star out of 4.5 should have been using money bought from Yelp. I dont eat Americanized rolls so I ordered the omakase which they asked for 50USD. Fishy was the only word in my mind when I was eating. Avoid!
author: Mandy W.

description: May is the best! Look for her when you come here and rest assured you're in good hands.
author: Benjamin T.

description: Good food and decent prices, friendly staff. Bill time they didn't listen when we asked to split the bill so they charged the amounts all wrong
author: Lisa D.

description:
This place is the right amount of hip, still perfectly approachable, and DELICIOUS. The staff here are ultra-friendly with a konnichiwa as you walk in, unsolicited and casual chef recommendations, and genuine, attentive service. The fish is so fresh and flavorful, they've got sake bombs (if you're into that), and new market specials every week.

I can't think of a better place to treat myself to a fun, impromptu sushi dinner.
author: Stephanie V.

description: Amazing sushi place! Had the Shrek as appetizer to share with my friend, very tasty!! We also took the loco roll and Treasure Island
author: Rachida I.

description:
I felt compelled to update my previous review because Nara just keeps getting better. I'm really impressed with how they keep moving the needle forward when they're already the premier spot in the area for sushi and sake. 

The menu is constantly changing and constantly improving and so are the quality and presentation of the dishes. They've refined an already satisfying nigiri game, broadened their selection of weekly fresh seafood (from Japan), and managed an inspiring level of creativity without making you feel like you're a participant in a culinary experiment. 

Nara was already at the top of the neighborhood food game, but I feel that these steady and significant improvements have made them a destination and one of the city's best kept secrets.
author: Uly J.

description:
We came in when they were having a scallop special. I'm very greatful, they were delicious! We also did a nigiri sampler which was also great. We were not too happy with the unagi, it was ok, but a bit well-done. 

I also really appreciate they have a guide to the sake they offer, helping you understand the differences and flavor profiles. We ended up with a sake that matched what we wanted perfectly. 

Good
- fresh fish
- good presentation
- friendly and helpful staff
- good ambiance and decor 

Not so good
- the two cooked items we got were a little overdone
author: Sarah B.

description:
We called ahead to make sure a table would be free for a party of 5, and I'm glad we did. 

When we arrived at Nara, our table was ready amid a crowd of people who hadn't planned ahead. While visibly jealous, the crowd was quickly placated by (presumably) complimentary glasses of sake while they waited. Only bummer was, our table was near the drafty open door. 

Our main server told us "all the servers are your server- just flag someone down if you need anything" and that was absolutely true, though occasionally confusing. 

We ordered several appetizers and a cold and hot sake to start-- the karaage was the best price:portion ratio ($6 for 15 small pieces) but we were also happy with the agedashi tofu, tuna tar tar, and hotate sliders. Then we ordered 5 rolls: effectively the first five on the menu, minus the veggie roll. 

I don't remember which roll was which, but I found all of them tasty. At one point we received a third roll that looked a lot like the first, and by the fourth realized we accidentally got a couple of the next table's rolls... Whoops! This happened 3 times, but it took us eating 2 extra rolls to figure it out. I think if the servers dropping off food were more consistent about announcing what was being delivered, we might've caught it sooner (not that we minded-- we got a lot of free extra food out if it). 

Total came to $35pp with tip for a generous amount of food and sake. The price for a group dinner was very reasonable compared to the beautiful plating, though the flavors and quality of the fish didn't knock my socks off (but to be fair, we didn't try the nigiri). 

All in all, a great new spot. The staff were all casual, funny, and very amicable-- they all seemed so genuinely happy to be there! The chefs and servers waved as we left. 

Nice enough place for a date, but casual enough for a weeknight out in the neighborhood.
author: Krista L.

description: We did the $70 omakase (supposed to be better quality fish than the $50 option), and I was really disappointed. The fish itself was poor quality, and I would have preferred a pricier omakase and/or fewer pieces over a ton of not so great fish. The starter and cooked foods were the saving grace. This place has such great reviews, my guess is you're much better off sticking to the hamachi starter, some cooked food, and a few rolls to share. Skip the sashimi and nigiri!!
author: Shirley L.

description:
We tried two different sushi rolls and both were great (expect $12-$15 per roll). Ramen is okay. There are better options in SF... Oysters were bad. They tasted fishy and both of us felt funny afterwards. Also we ordered Asahi on draft at happy hour and it was $5 instead of $4 just because it's Asahi (no signage to tell us this but one dollar isn't a big deal)

Update: my husband actually got food poisoning from the oysters.
author: A N.

description: Very modern/hip looking restaurant.  Perfect ambiance and music.  We had the miyagi oyster shooters which were extremely fresh and very flavorful.  Although this place is a little pricey, it's worth every penny !
author: Journ C.

description: I'm visiting a friend this weekend. We decided to get sushi for dinner and came across this little gem (after a little time in traffic). We started with the snow sake and it went down smooth and warm (even though it was cold sake). We followed that with the miyagi oysters (West Coast oysters are the best!). They top the oysters with a little roe and it was a nice treat. We had much more to eat after that and suffice it to say this place is highly recommended. Plus the atmosphere is great!
author: Ngoc D.

description: As good as sushi gets that's not the $100+ omakaze. Never disappoints. Menu is creative, and just darn delicious. Fun vibe. Excellent service.
author: Lily H.

description: I came here because the other restaurant I wanted to go to was closing. So I decided to stop in here for a quick dinner. I ordered the ramen, chef's choice of sashimi, and tuna tartare. The ramen was very disappointing. I wouldn't recommend ordering it. The broth was bland and the only thing that was anything like ramen was the noodle texture. The chefs choice of sashimi was okay. Nothing too impressive. The best thing I ordered was the tuna tartare. That was the only thing I really enjoyed there. I won't be coming back unless I happen to be in the area and want to try their happy hour.
author: Lynn T.

description:
Meh. The food was over-dressed and not amazingly cooked. We had the chirashi, pork belly and "heart attack" roll. 

Pork belly declared that it was 24 hour slow cooked, and I expected it to be soft as butter but it was actually tough. It seems like the easiest thing to get right, oh well. 

Everything looked fancy enough but it all tasted pretty boring andoverly salted. 

Also, don't come here looking for Japanese style sushi, it's definitely very californianized.
author: Marek B.

description:
What a lovely restaurant ! I went to nara for my birthday and they perfectly made my day. We (me and 3 girls lol) had hamachi truffle , Walu tataki salad, maguro tar tar, and Shrek for appetizers ! It was just amazing . Especially I liked their hamachi truffle a lot. It served on spoon and the decoration of food was so cute. And shrek is definitely something you have to get !:)
Love it here.
author: Sol-a M.

description: Probably my favorite sushi joint in the city. Always fresh and delicious - I literally haven't ordered one bad thing. They have tons of inventive dishes and rolls, but also do the classics superbly. And then there's the sake! The owner is super passionate about sake and gave my friend and I some free samples of his bountiful collection. The staff are always friendly and accommodating. Love this place!
author: Katie C.

description: Can we talk about salmon dankness?!?? Fish is so fresh and happy hour deals are every day. Love that the Haight has delicious hidden sushi gems like Nara and Ginza. Would fully recommend to a friend and a stranger. Prices are SF style and staff is friendly!
author: Mark M.

description:
Great location, awesome vibe, expensive food. The standard california roll was not on the menu, yet every roll that did make an appearance was at least $13. I think the average price per roll was about $16 (crazy expensive, especially considering none of them even sounded good). 

The vibe in Nara is nice, it feels authentic, as they greet you on your way in and yell at you as you leave. Yet, their sashimi doesn't quite make the cut. We ordered the following sashimi: salmon, hamachi, saba, horse mackerel, amaebi, and ocean trout. Of all of these, the horse mackerel was pretty good, and the rest tasted like I could have gotten it at any cheap sushi place. 

We also ordered the hamachi kama, which was only ok. Some parts were really juicy, and other parts were charred so bad that I had to spit it out. 

The scallop sampler was nice, at $18, it was basically scallops prepared three ways--which makes the price point definitely worth it, and it was probably the best thing we got.  

Our server was really friendly, she checked back on us just enough to make us not feel forgotten, but not enough that I couldn't have a conversation with my date. Seems more like a hipster place for those who want to have a cool place to hang on Haight, definitely not a place to go out of your way for sushi.
author: Lisa N.

description: Love this place! The rolls are delicious, and while it would be nice if they had some simpler rolls (no simple Maki rolls), the service is great and sake and beer options are unbeatable. I will definitely be back.
author: Joshua B.

description: We wanted to try a new sushi spot and where driving down Haight and saw this hip sushi spot, so why not try.  Atmosphere was cool, had a good vibe, and they were playing the dubs so it was a win win. We ordered a couple appetizers, the chicken karage  and the rice bombs. We got about 4 rolls to start, and noticed they had shabu. We ordered that too, the sushi was good. Fresh fish. We had to wait a bit for the shabu and it was not what i expected. For $20 we got about 6 small peices of beef and maybe a handful of veggies since the 3 of us shared. The food was good here, but not worth the price and the amount of food. When dinner was over I wanted to go get a sausage. It is a nice place if you want to take a date out, food was god, but not good enough for the price we paid.
author: Sean M.

description: This place is awesome for large parties and a good time with friends! The sushi is delicious and the sake on point. Staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, I wanted them to join our table for a shot of sake. Best sushi dining experience I've had in SF!
author: Gories K.

description:
Sadly just sad. 

Rolls were decent.... but this restaurant seriously made me question all yelp reviews since Nara is so highly rated and this was arguably the worst sushi I've ever had. 


Though, it's possible it was better than the worst all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant I've been to.
author: Russell W.

description:
Was kind of iffy at first because I don't usually like fusion Japanese restaurants, but this place is bomb. Ramen and big boss roll were on point. A lot of the dishes feature a spicy ingredient. I don't handle spice very well, but maybe I'll muster up the courage to try the spicy dishes one day cuz they look/sound delicious.

What gives Nara 5 stars instead of a 4 is the amazing service. Makes me so happy when a new restaurant opens and they have their shit together from day 1 instead of trying to wing it and work out all the kinks as they go. Will definitely return to try out the impeccable sake selection that I keep reading about.
author: Mikaela S.

description:
Best Sushi in Bay area.
Best Beer in Bay area. I never taste beer like this before. 
Best Sake in Bay area. 
Especially, Fish is very fresh. Sashimi cut is big and thick. 
Roll is something different. 
Appetizer is reasonable good price. very delicious. 
Music is very good. People's are very kind.
Owner Sunny is very good person. He is very professional about fish and Sushi. 
They always try to make new fusion style dish. 
Try it. It is best ever.
author: YongJoo J.

description:
I'm a big fan of one dollar oyster, which is only during happy hour. but the oysters come room temperature... not sure if that's normal... i ate 5 of them and didn't die. so that was good.

not dying is a good first step. the warm sake, which is also happy hour thing, is also good. we ordered a roll, a pork belly thing, and stuff avocado thing. they are ok. nothing offensive. i can't say i like it. they are all ok. but i still have hopes about this place. their menu is actually quite interesting. i live in the neighborhood, so i will swing by to brave room-temperature oysters and more warm food on the back of the menu. 

it wasn't loud during dinner time, which is a plus. but like many places, they want all of us to be there before seating us. but really though. it's so not busy during thursday peak dinner time. it's just annoying. 

ok i'm not sure how i feel about this place anymore. i'll go again i guess.
author: Te R.

description: Strongly recommend this place. Relaxed and chic environment. Fantastic service, Yumi was our waitress and she made our night. The food was incredible, both for our taste buds as well as the visuals.
author: Fanny Y.

description:
One of my favorite sushi places in town!
I am picky when it comes to sushi. I am not one of those who gets a bento box when going to a Japanese place although I have nothing against bento boxes. I grew up in Aisa where Japanese food is everywhere, easily better than places in the U.S, and are a lot more affordable so it takes a lot for me to give five stars. 

Let's talk about customer service. Every single staff at Nara including the servers and chefs were friendly and welcoming. Also they were very knowledgable about their specials and the menu. I mean what more can I ask?

Excellent food. The quality of the fish Nara serves is not something you find in any Japanese restaurants. They are super fresh and delicious. I really enjoyed their uni, striped horse mackerel, premium Japanese snapper, golden eye snapper, and Hawaiian amberjack. Also these are not typical fish you find anywhere. I highly recommend Nara if you want to try something unique and different. Also I'm not a huge fan of rolls because rolls tend to overshadow the taste of the fish with sauce and other ingredients. However Nara's rolls are amazing and super tasty and don't overshadow the fish. Some of my favorites are Big boss, heartattack, and special K. 

Daily specials. Every day from 5-7 they have a happy hour deal where draft beer and hot Sake are $1 off and they have one dollar oysters. If you are an oyster lover like myself, you def should check this place out. 

Overall I have amazing time every time i visit Nara.    I highly recommend this place to any sushi lovers like myself
author: Sunjoo K.

description: This place is amazing!! Every bite is calculated perfection - highly recommend the hibachi special
author: Diana D.

description:
New place in the lower haight that has been so desperately needed. Nara is such a great addition and amazing Japanese restaurant. My husband and I stumbled by this place and noticed it for the first time today. They have been open for only 3 weeks and are already bumping on a Saturday night. You are greeted at the door with a "hi" in unison by the sushi cooks!

Food was awesome. The Hamachi Truffle is an absolute must. On of the best appetizers I have had yet. It comes in little spoons so perfect to share with the table. In regards to rolls we had the Sake Bomb and the Heart Attack. We also had the chicken karage. All were great!

So you are so welcome to the neighborhood Nara, we will definitely return!
author: Ellinor M.

description: One of my favorite places, to take an Omakase flight of amazing sushi tasting menu. The cooked menu items are also very interesting and tasty.
author: Jason G.

description: We walked in and the hostess ignored us for a while. When we were finally seated, the menus were slammed down on the table then the waitress walked away and never came back. We ended up leaving.
author: Rachel K.

description: THIS PLACE WAS AMAZING!!! I went like a month ago and am constantly thinking about it. It will RUIN you for other sushi.
author: Natalie K.

description: AMAZING. FOOD. Everything about this place is great, food, drinks, ambience, staff, etc. It gets busy so make sure you make a reservation or be ready to wait and yes, the wait is worth it! I came here to celebrate my birthday and it was the best decision EVER :)
author: Erin T.

description: This place is really neat! George, our server is really nice and excellent! We wanted miso soup and he said they were out but ended up having it and giving it to us on the house! And while me and my best friend were eating our delicious miso soup, our server ran out to give someone their belonging. This is really an excellent restaurant to eat at
author: Roberto H.

description: We enjoyed the full range of food, from chilled starters to beef short ribs to the sushi. Well done! Also good service. There was a misunderstanding of what we ordered, but it was corrected for us.
author: Rory E.

description: Yeah!!! Finally we found an awesome sushi restaurant in SF!!  Kudos to my hubby!!  He found this place on Yelp and it has an outstanding reviews so we decided to gave it a try. We loved the atmosphere and the ambience. The service was great!! All the sushi are fresh and the kitchen food are delicious! They really pay attention to the presentation of every dish that comes out. Not to mentioned they have an awesome 80s playlist and modern day lite pop!! . We will definitely make this place as our regular!!
author: Becky K.

description:
Watch your bill!

I came here based on the 4 1/2 start and $1 HH oyster. I ordered staff which should be around $60 but I ended up with $100 bill. Here is why:  

1) Handroll Processing Fee, beside the Handroll sampler, which is fixed price of $13, all other handroll will be charged $1/handroll extra for "special order processing service". This fee is not listed anywhere on the manual, so, be aware of that. 

2) Billing discrepancy, the manual states one price and your bill will state another. Watch out for that.

3) Communication issue, I ordered toro and bintoro handroll and I got o-toro and something else per the bill. The o-toro tasted just like toro, so it never occurred to me that what I got was not what I ordered. And I ended up with 3x of the cost.
