4) I kept getting the plates that was not ordered by me. And I had to reminded the wait staff what I had order since they easily forgot. 

I would give 4 starts for the quality of the ingredients; 3 stars for sushi; 2 stars for the bathroom (very messy); and 1 star for the service (The wait staff were friendly with beautiful smile. These are good people, but not good service provider).

I have to conclude that Nara and I are not meant to be for each other. Once is enough.
author: Lydia L.

description:
Amazing food, and best sushi in the neighborhood. Hands Down.  Service is great, seafood quality is amazing and their sake selection is fantastic.

Favorites:

Hamachi truffle ponzu special****
Unagi roll***
Oysters
author: Tianna J.

description: Nara never disappointed. Solid Japanese food with a creative twist. My favorite sushi place in town.
author: Isabelle G.

description: It's all about the Special K roll.  So. Damn. Good. Everything else is also quite delicious.  Great service as well!
author: Yue X.

description: Awesome happy hour. $1.50 oysters along with $5 hand rolls that are a great size. They have great selections and they're omakse is priced great.
author: Trung T.

description:
I loved the atmosphere and concept of the place, but the food just wasn't great. I was so disappointed with the sashimi and nigiri dishes we got. Toro, Sake, Albacore, Amaebi and Tobiko.

Karaage was a joke, it was really dry and no flavor to the batter. Again, this place has so much potential! I really wouldn't mind paying the price ($$$: Avg. $10-$15 an order) if the food quality was better. Service and chefs were great, traditional "irrashaimase" upon entering and "arigato" when leaving. 

Otherwise, for sushi quality... There's tons of other places in the city that has better quality fish. If I lived in the area, I'd definitely go there more often but why when you have Iza Ramen around the corner! RAMEN... NOM!
author: Jackie O.

description: Nice to find a delicious sushi spot. I would give it five stars but I like to reserve that for sushi nakazawa type places. The hamachi truffle and asari miso soup are legit.
author: Steve I.

description: Came for my buddies birthday, they sat our big party no problem!  Good good, good service!
author: Jaime P.

description: Awesome place to have drinks and food at! The staff was attentive, food was good, ambience is great for a late night dinner.
author: Dan L.

description: I've been coming here since it opened and have never been disappointed. Fish is always fresh and well prepared, and prices are reasonable. Awesome staff and atmosphere too.
author: Narek A.

description:
It's a Korean take on Japanese food and it's awesome. Services are awesome and appetizers are so creative - we Japanese cannot copy that creation!

You would think "korean-made sushi???" but turned out - Nara's chef has incredible care and attentions to their dish and I am always impressed by their "Japanese style" sushi - and as for "American sushi" - THEY ARE AWESOMELY FATTY AND YUMMY!

I have become their biggest fan !!!!
author: Takahiro K.

description:
Nara just popped up out of nowhere recently and its bomb as fuck. Their presentation is spot on and their veggie sushi, if youre into that, is also pretty spectacular in my opinion. Friendly wait staff, awesome greetings and goodbyes, beautiful space and ambiance. Its fun to sit at the sushi bar with one other person (usually theres space for that amount) and watch them make these insanely well presented dishes you have no idea what they are. 

Its a little pricey, but if you're a boss or want to go on a date then DO IT! Best sushi in Nopa, Haight and Hayes vicinity in my opinion. I've lived in Nopa for 5 years waiting for something better than Tsunami to emerge. 10/10!
author: Robbie S.

description: Sushi rolls were ok, but we couldn't believe what we saw  when Shabu Shabu was brought to our table. It was NOT Shabu Shabu, more like Sukiyaki...
author: M G.

description: Nara was an incredibly fun and delicious trip through a multitude of cleverly composed Japanese fusion flavors. My partner and I went for Valentine's Day, and both of us left full, fulfilled, and drunk in love (and off sake). He focused on the $50 prixe fixe whereas I went for the $80. While I appreciated the vast range of flavors, I honestly think it was a little too much food. The highlight of course was the sashimi. Absolutely mindblowing fresh fish. The dessert I did not like, a cold ginger creme brulee, which was presented beautifully, but I prefer my brulees traditional and warm, flamed to serve. Would recommend though and will go back!!
author: Thea B.

description: Fun sushi experience with various fish and meat to try. I started off with some happy hour oysters and spicy tuna sushi rolls which I found were no more than OK. The fish tacos were delicious and Nara took it to a higher level with the Hamachi Truffle and the Special K rolls with butterfish, I hear butterfish is acquired taste with a strange texture to some, I really enjoyed it though. We rounded off the dinner with hot sake and mochi ice cream. A fun experience testing many new things!
author: Jian K.

description:
Walked in on Saturday night and a table for two was ready in about 5 minutes. We ordered warm sake, oysters, and a few rolls. Their menu is not that extensive but they have specials on the board above the sushi bar. Everything was really delicious. My favorite being the oysters and the Jessica Alba roll. 
Ambience is modern with wooden tables and bench chairs along the wall. Seems to be a good place to catch up with friends over their sake and beer menu.
author: Patricia S.

description:
Group dinner friendly AF.

The fish was fresh, the hot apps were great as well. We even loved the edamame. 

Everyone was super nice and we had great service.
author: Amanda H.

description: Amazing ambiance and great food! The service was excellent! I loved the low key lighting.  We sat at the sushi bar. It was a real joy watching he sushi chief work their magic. Will surely come here again and be sure to try the sale bomb roll
author: Lisa C.

description: this may be the best salmon belly i've ever had...wow super great experience and really fun chefs! recommend sitting at the bar so you can watch the skilled chefs prepare amazing dishes! loved the appetizer the hamachi truffle (like most people) and shared the omakase and big boss roll with my girlfriend which was the perfect amount of food! they also have an amazing sake selection, i would definitely recommend this place for date night!!
author: Will M.

description: Dinner with friends. We loved the food, drinks and all the good deals at happy hour followed a proper romp through their main dinner menu Our waitress Yumi  was very accommodating and kept up with our crazy ordering. At one point different people around the table were having appetizers, entrees and desserts at the same time. The decor was nice, and the slightly noisy atmosphere didn't bother us when drowned out by a flood of cheap and/or free warm sake. The agedashi tofu, salmon collar and mochi ice cream are highly recommended.
author: Cheng X.

description: Nara is our go-to sushi joint in SF. The food is consistently spectacular, the fish wonderfully fresh and the asahi endlessly cold. I can't recommend the chicken karaage enough, but make sure it is spicy. The shrek is a joy to uncover and the butterfish addiction is, well, addicting. Definitely worth a trip.
author: Guy S.

description: I'm jumping on the Himachi Truffle bandwagon...they've nailed that one...happiness in your mouth...worth going for that alone!  Service was fun.  We went late and they were out of Miso Soup :(. We ordered based on the waitress recommendations for rolls and they didn't disappoint.  Finished off with the ginger creme brulee.  Everything was sublime!
author: Tracie P.

description:
Nara Sushi bar on Polk has been our go-to sushi bar. The owner and staff provide a tasty and enjoyable dining experience that has us returning weekly for the past 8 years.

This new venture from the owner of Nara on Polk puts the focus on great Sake, and provides a new and delightful spin on Japanese and sushi standards. The menu changes frequently, and we usually try the specials to gain new food experiences.   

The space is beautiful, and the food artful. We have some new favorite sake's curated from their great selection. Gold sake, presidential sake, and Korean sake have all been tasted and thoroughly enjoyed. This is a great place for after theater or concert dining as they are open late.
author: Heidi S.

description: I actually came to this place from a recommendation of a friend.  The area itself is not bad but you can tell it will be full of great places to eat and drink in a little more time.  Inside the restaurant it's nice, clean and looks great.  The staff is very friendly and attentive when there.  My party and I had two bottles of wine and many different rolls.  We ordered some special rolls along with some basic rolls which were good as well.  Nothing amazing about the food but it was good and tasted fresh.  However, the water tasted a little funny.  Not sure why that was but when asked for sparkling water or something else they didn't have.  Interesting.  I would recommend this place and give it a try.
author: Sean D.

description:
Really great place to hang out for 20-s and 30-s. Nice, very clean, good decorations, and just great to hang out with friends. 
fill-more rolls were great! Can't wait to try other items on menu.
author: Artem M.

description: Best Omakase I've ever had for $50! It's so cheap yet soo good! Very melt in your mouth pieces of sashimi and nigiri. LOVED their toro and all the other pieces of sashimi. It is definitely more than one person can eat. We had to help our friend eat her Omakase. The quail egg uni was also amazing as well as all of the other dishes we ordered. Pictures are included.
author: Grace L.

description: Great sushi restaurant on haight st. Sushi was very fresh and reasonably priced. The salmon sushi was to die for. It melted in your mouth and we just kept ordering more. Also had the tuna and salmon hand roll which was very generously stuffed with plenty of fish.  Had a sushi roll with potato chips on top... Sounds kinda weird but was delicious. I think all sushi should now be eaten with potato chips!
author: Robert C.

description: Best omakase for the price!  They have a $50 one and a $70 one.  I went for the smaller and it was still plenty of food.  10 pieces of sashimi, 4 pieces of nigiri, hamachi collar and dessert.  Great neighborhood spot and will definitely be coming here often!
author: Sandra P.

description:
Not fantastic but not bad. 

Came here on a Sunday night with a large group and was easily able to get reservations. Ordered the nigri plate and handroll plate. The fish was good but nothing memorable... although the handroll was stuffed with too much fish. Too much fish?! I know. I think if the quality was excellent, I wouldn't mind too much fish ;)

Next time I'm defnitely getting the ramen!
author: Nho C.

description: Nara is my favorite sushi in SF! Everyone who works here is so friendly and helpful - my server today gave me a thorough sake 101 education and helped me choose the perfect bottle. Fantastic, upbeat ambiance.
author: Deandra A.

description:
This is hands down my favorite spot in the neighborhood and one of my favorite restaurants in the city. The food is excellent and the owner/staff kick so much ass, Nara is always a fun place to be. It's a great place for a meal or a few rounds with good food for accompaniment, and the happy hour is great. 

More detailed review:

First things first, the food is excellent. Whether you're in the mood for sushi or something heavier / cooked, Nara's got you covered. The fish is very fresh so it's great as sashimi/nigiri or in their rolls, some of which are incredible. They always have daily specials listed on the board behind the sushi bar that oftentimes sell out.

Last time I was here I had the seven-course omakase, which was an insane amount of food. There were lots of rolls, the kind that come with sauces or are deep fried or have fusion-y ingredients like cream cheese. They were delicious, but I was hoping for some really good simple fresh fish. Just when I thought that wasn't coming, a plate of I think seven types of sashimi was served, followed by seven types of nigiri. There was also salad, a course of cooked fish, miso soup with veggies and seafood, and creme brulee for dessert. I may have missed something else, but my point is it was all top-notch and a lot of food.

From the regular menu some favorites include hamachi truffle, garlic butter edamame, chicken karaage (I prefer spicy), "it's like butter" (incredible fish dish), hamachi kama, big boss roll, and the ramen. Aside from the soups everything is easy to share, which makes coming here with friends even more fun.

The atmosphere is awesome here, from the tasteful decor to the friendly and welcoming staff. I've gotten to know some of them, including chefs Kevin and Danny, both a lot of fun and great at what they do. George, one of the servers, is always attentive and friendly. And the owner Sonny, who you'll sometimes see wandering table to table, is an awesome guy who is doing things right with this restaurant.

There's an izakaya / gastropub vibe here, so even though the food is legit it's also a great place to grab drinks (though no liquor, so don't expect that). They have a few beers on tap and some imported bottles as well as an extensive sake menu. It can be a bit loud but never rowdy, which for me is perfect. They have good playlists to keep the atmosphere upbeat.

If you live nearby or are looking for a new sushi spot, definitely check this place out!
author: Joseph N.

description:
This place is a good first date spot. Even though I feel it's technically in The Haight but it says Hayes Valley. We had the following dishes:

DRINK
- Alradin / Unfiltered Sake - Not too sweet or bitter, Very good.

STARTERS
- Wakame Salad - Very fresh & good
- Edamame - love the rock salt (could have been hotter)
- Korean Pork Buns - Very spicy (and I like spice) but very good.

MAINS
- Heart Attack - good tuna but could have been spicier.
- Treasure Island - My favorite - Crispy outside and the cream cheese filling... sooo good!

All together, the bill was $60 which is VERY reasonable.

I would highly recommend this place!
author: Ryan R.

description:
Sushi's presentation are good but taste is below average. Basically, they have very limited selection of sushi and there is too many different sauces added to the rolls. I would give it 3 start for the sushi but considering their prices that are way above average, i think they deserve 2 start. We usually pay $130-140 for a party of two at good sushi restaurants. We ended up paying $120 at Nara but we did not enjoyed our sushi's that much.
I think there are definitely better sushi places in SF for the same amount of money.
author: Reza F.

description: If you want red flavorless water, texturizer still on the meat and Top Ramen noodles of college yesteryear, have your ramen here. Otherwise go to Halu. The only thing I asked for was no bamboo and it was in there in spades. No thanks.
author: Alana W.

description: The Nara salad was small for $6. It should have been put on a smaller plate for the amount given. Agadeshi was good and would recommend. Sake Rei Junmai Ginjo Draft Sho Chiku Bai was delicious, crisp, refreshing, slightly sweet, and highly recommend for a cheap sake, $16. I don't think Jessica Alba would like her role. The Loco Roll is pretty good. There are better sushi places in SF but if you're in the neighborhood, you can try for yourself. Nice rustic social atmosphere.
author: Hoosie U.

description: This place is great! Very courteous service and delicious food. Good subtle vibes and a nice atmosphere. Bring friends to relax on mini communal tables all night long!. Semi decent selection of sake and drinks. Place seems like it can get pretty busy, so make sure to make a reservation during peak hours. Had the Otoro sashimi with happy hour oysters and wagyu beef which is A5 certified!
author: Andy Y.

description: Great place to go for happy hour on a Friday! Fun atmosphere, awesome sake selection and friendly staff... definitely recommend the $1.50 oysters and the spicy salmon hand rolls!
author: Anna M.

description: Tried to update my review to 6 stars but it seems 5 is the limit. Don't think twice about coming here. Grab a seat at the counter and let Kevin look after you. You won't be disappointed.
author: Barry O.

description: Went here for the third time and loved it every time! Friendly waitstaff, great sushi, and free hot sake for posting this
author: Gordon S.

description:
My boyfriend John is a regular here and they treat him (and me) like family. We went in last night with some friends for his 35th birthday party and it was above and beyond our expectations. We had the best time!

I would HIGHLY recommend this spot for a special occasion. The chefs (special thanks to Kevin!!) made us so much delicious food we could hardly move when we left.

George and the front of house team gave us spectacular service.

Do yourself a favor and host your next birthday party here.
author: Becca M.

description:
Food is decent. Sushi good but not outstanding; other plates try too hard to be unique and end up being a bit embarrassing. Service was a failure. Nara's seating game and administration are weak. After we finally sat there wasn't any point in the process that went smoothly.... it usually took us asking bus boys to track down our server before we could order drinks, food, or a check. One of our plate orders was put in incorrectly which capped off the evening of poor service.

Bites were so small we ended up getting to-go across the street afterward which was the most enjoyable meal of the evening by far.
author: Blake W.

description: My boyfriend and I absolutely love this place! The food is delicious and the staff is so friendly and attentive. It exudes a positive energy and atmosphere. Great place to grab some excellent sushi and sake on the weekends. All around amazing experience every time and would definitely recommend to all my friends and family. George is the man, and Chef Kevin and Chef Danny are the best. Chef Kevin made us one of the best sushi dishes we've had in as long as we can remember. Just ask him to put something together and he won't disappoint. A+++++++
author: Elana L.

description: This place is amazing! Great staff,super friendly great atmosphere and the food was mouth watering simply delicious. If you go ask for Jamie very knowledgeable of everything on the menu which I thought was awesome. Chef Ray took really good care of me and my girlfriend.
author: Corey F.

description: Very fun, relaxed, casual, knowledgable staff.  Amazing quality of fish, oysters, and sake. If I lived in this city - I'm in NYC - I would be a regular here.
author: Abby G.

description: Thanks to May , the food was delicious and the servers were so funny. Had a great evening ! . Definitely comming back
author: Simon B.

description: They have a happy hour everyday $1.50 Miyagi Oyster and $1 off Draft 5-7pm-! And Hamachi truffle. Must try.
author: May Y.

description:
You don't need me to tell you that Nara is 5*  - they have a ton of 5* reviews.    
 
I'm going to tell you anyway.  
 
SF does not have that many options for high quality sushi.  It's either Ozumo-class ($150/person), or Tokyo "trip to the toilet" Express. 

Nara gives you a higher end experience, with a  more modest price tag.  My party of three ordered enough food for a party of 5, and got out of there for $150 with tip.  That's what's up.  
 
Ambiance is wonderful inside, and the waitstaff is prompt, and friendly.  
 
The only potential downside is that it's in the lower haight, which can be a bit grungy, if you are sensitive to that.  And forget about parking. It's not happening.  
 
That's not Nara's fault though, that's yours - for not using Uber.
author: Adam P.

description: The kimchi shrimp tacos are to die for! So much flavor! The hospitality is amazing and the music selection is also awesome. Great for birthdays and gatherings!
author: Henna T.

description: Solid 3 stars. Nice atmosphere, good service, mediocre sushi. Not sure why others have ranked so highly.
author: Chris B.

description: This place is HELLA good! Chef Kevin hooked it up with some of the best Sushi we have had in a while. (we are def going to try and sit in front of his station again when we come back) The Sake Bomb roll was amazing (super spicy but yummy) and the pork buns & unagi were on HIT!! The presentation was also pretty. My boyfriend and I were watching him make sushi the whole time and Woah does this dude have amazing cutting and rolling precision. The vibes in the restaurant are super chill, fresh and hip. The staff is really friendly and accomadating as well. The prices are not bad either. They do play top 40 while you eat your food but it's so tasty that you don't pay attention to anything else. We are definitely making this our new go to sushi spot!
author: Nicole D.

description: My husband and I came here for happy hour and had a great time. The food was delicious and our waitress, Yumi, was pleasant and attentive which made our experience that much better. We will definitely be coming back again!
author: Joanna C.

description: FINALLY a great restaurant in the Lower Haight--and sushi to boot! Elephant Sushi now has some pretty hefty competition. As 2 avid sushi snobs of 20+ years, my husband and I were blown away. The fish was fresh, the prices were reasonable, there were a lot of menu options addition to a large specials board behind the sushi bar. Chef Danny's dessert creations are amazing; save room! The Avocado Chocolate Mousse and Ginger Creme Brûlée were out of this world!! The waitstaff was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
STOP YELLING!
Every time someone comes in or leaves they yell.
Every time an order is ready they yell.
This ruined our whole experience at Nara.
The food isn't bad but the yelling in addition to the loud music (and sometimes cheesy music, they try to have something for everyone so it ranges from classic rock to soulless crappy pop songs) makes the whole experience very oppressive.
Don't go with a date and don't go if you want to have a conversation.
The world is oppressive and violent enough and Haight street has enough rowdy bars. I was so excited to get a cool new Japanese place in the hood but this is one is trying way too hard to be hipster and trendy.
I hope George (the owner) reads the reviews and decides to tell his staff to stop yelling so I can go back to Nara, enjoy the food and revamp my review.
author: Monkey B.

description: Some of the best rolls I've had in the city. Great service. The space is no frills, by the food and atmosphere are fantastic.
author: Sarah K.

description: what is going on. is this a dream? 90's hip hop, sake bombs, the most legitimate nigiri and sushi in San Francisco, first class service, and the coolest staff...EVER. I only review the best in the business. these guys don't mess around. must try. come here with your friends and see what happens. and most definitely try the daily specials on the wall behind the sushi bar.
author: Kevin L.

description:
3.5 rounded up because I thought the employees were good.

Don't go here for the food - it's only average, both taste and quality, and over-priced. The ambiance is nice and the service is friendly and fast.

Really odd is that they don't serve tea! Our server said it was because the tenant next door was a coffee and tea shop so they were trying to be a good neighbor. Wtf. The place across the street serves fish... why aren't you making fishless sushi too? Dumb.
author: Janice J.

description:
They say there is a first for everything and tonight's first really should have been a red flag.  Tonight was the first time that I experienced a "Japanese" restaurant that did not have tea.  It was strange that the waitress did not offer a reason as to why there was no hot water for tea and then instead said she could microwave a glass of hot water (which was then served in a glass meant for cold water.)

Some of the critiques from the meal:
-bok choy, yes, bok choy and white button mushrooms instead of shiitake mushrooms in the ramen along with a extremely thin broth.  I'm convinced that the spicy ramen broth was the Shin Ramen packet.
-I would typically not eat California rolls but when my friend discovered that there were actual Pop rocks in his, I had to give it a try...understand the attempt to do something innovative but this was quite appalling.

Competition is fierce in SF and I wish Nara luck, however, I will be spending my money elsewhere.
author: Christopher W.

description: This place is awesome! From the hip wooden interior, to the welcoming nature of the employees, the restaurant provides the perfect experience. It isn't overly bougie but the food is still delicious and high quality. Exactly what we wanted for a casual dinner out :)
author: zoe n.

description: Fresh fish and good rolls. The noise level was super loud with club type music. Probably fun for a younger crowd but not a place for a nice date or if you wanted to have a conversation.  Excessively drunk and loud people from all directions and it was only 7:30 on a Thursday.  Had to ask for water and the check, but otherwise good service. Had the sashimi, special k roll and pork buns.  It seemed that the cooked items didn't shine as well as the raw items.   Overall, won't be back but some good qualities.
author: jennifer m.

description: Great atmosphere and service! Just went for drinks, but every dish that went by looked delicious. They also have an excellent sake selection. Definitely recommend if you're in the mood for Japanese!
author: Saila B.

description: Go for Happy Hour, drink too much Hot Sake and eat more Oysters than you think you possibly can. We did.. and had a great meal and a lot of laughs. Great service too!
author: Sunny C.

description:
Sit at the bar. The chefs are so much fun! Chef Sean will definitely take care of you. 

The wait staff is friendly as well. 

Wouldn't have expected such a great environment in the Haight.
author: Becca I.

description: Super friendly staff and great quality fish. Always get the uni. This place is definitely a sleeper hit, never tough to get in, clearly hasn't been discovered yet by the "foodie" or hipster crowds, despite its location in the Haight. Solid go to for sushi in SF - will keep coming back.
author: C L.

description:
I expect this place to be decent with the high ratings. Unfortunately the ratings were misleading. 

Since the Warriors game was on we asked if they can switch the channel. They switched it but it was golf. So we said its the wrong game. The waiter dude said what's the problem?  We said it was switched to the wrong game. His response "it's the f***in game!  Wow great customer service. 

Now to the food. If you want true Japanese sushi this is definitely not the place. It's run by Koreans so it's not authentic Japanese food. I have to agree with some tellers that the food was meh and very expensive. 

We were waiting at least 20 mins to try and get any waiter to give us the check. They were all more busy socializing and sitting with their friends or regulars. Definitely never going back.
author: Mary L.

description:
From the chorus line singing IRASSHAIMASE!! to the K-Pop style birthday chant, this place is a blast!

I grabbed a seat at the bar with my dear friend and had Kevin as my sushi chef.  His presentation skills are stellar!  I loved everything he gave me, including some fish from Japan as well as otoro - Holy moley delicious!  We shared a large rice beer, maguro carpaccio, the nigiri tasting and the special roll from the board topped with uni.  Everything else he was making looked divine and it was heart breaking to see it go to the other people in the restaurant! I'll be back for more!

P.s. don't miss the chocolate-avocado mousse for dessert ;)
author: Cory N.

description:
best sushi in the area.
love the bear. i will defiantly visit again
author: David S.

description:
It was good sushi / sashimi, but it is definitely not a "weekly sushi joint," instead it would be more a special occasions place. 

It has super fancy rolls and it is less "pure" than I am used to (I mean, one of the rolls had POP ROCK CANDY in it... didn't have the guts to try that.) But for being so "upscale" it had wooden chopsticks, which surprised me.

Also, the music is really loud, so conversation is kind of difficult, but I think it would be great with a group.
author: Stephanie C.

description: The food was delicious, the service was excellent, and the sushi chefs were cool. Oh, and they played good music.
author: Peter E.

description:
HOLY COW! Sweet baby Jesus! This place is amazing. This has become our favorite sushi spot! 

$1/oyster! The miyagi oysters and the soy dressing is insane...yup...ate 24 of them! 

Himachi truffle is the bomb! Must order this!

Katsu salad- I want to bathe in that house made dressing goodness.

Big Boss - big boss...

Sake Bomb - my favorite!!!!

Miso soup - Soooooo goooood

Nigiri sushi in general - superb!!

Service - A+

I love you Nara. See you next week (or tomorrow)
author: Candace D.

description:
I checked out Nara at Yelp's suggestion and I was not at all disappointed!

I sat at the sushi bar alone, and the chefs and the owner made me feel right at home. They were really friendly, even offering me a complimentary palate cleanser (the blood orange sorbet - tart, but delicious!) and giving me a little tasting of some Japanese-style mountain yam when I asked what they were preparing.

Chef Kevin's nigiri sampler was incredibly well curated - the best nigiri sampler I think I've ever had. Most places give you the usual stuff in a nigiri sampler: salmon, tuna, yellowtail, shrimp, etc. The nigiri sampler they prepared for me had none of these things. Each piece was carefully crafted and individually seasoned, as it should be. At $28 for the 7-piece sampler, it was also a decent value considering the fish they give you.

I also tried the ginger creme brulee at their suggestion. The presentation was beautiful and the ginger wasn't overpowering - a perfect ending to a really great dinner!

I found the prices to be pretty good - definitely not the most expensive sushi I've ever had, but not the most inexpensive place ever either. All in all, I'd say it was worth the price, especially for the personalized experience I had. I'll definitely be back!
author: Sophia C.

description: My go to spot for yummy sushi!  Their Happy Hour everyday from 5-7PM with $1 Oysters, Draft Beer & Sake.  Very fresh Sushi and Sashimi at a decent price. Get the Amaebi...my favorite!
author: Michelle M.

description: Wow what a restaurant! This place has exciting and creative sushi options that are aptly and humorously named.  Service is speedy, food is delicious, and the shot of the day is worth a try...
author: Mike S.

description: I thought the food was alright for what it was, non authentic but trendy sushi, but a good trade off to be sat quickly and is in the neighborhood, or so I thought. The service was probably the worst I've ever received in San Francisco. It took 20 minutes for the waitress to come over and ask for a drink order, when we finished our apps and wanted to order more we could not get the waitresses attention until literally standing up and asking if we could order a few more things. And of course when we were finally done, we sat with nothing in our glasses or on our plates for another 25 minutes before having to get up again to ask for the bill. I never tip less than 20% but it did not feel deserved after being completely ignored for almost the entire meal.
author: Jessica S.

description: Amazing new restaurant with delicious fresh fish and awesome drinks. The sushi chef was very friendly and helpful with our selection. Thank you. Will definitely return.
author: Jason W.

description: We ordered the Omakase on a Saturday night, but we were not impressed...food wasn't that good.  This was my first time here, so I am willing to go back and try the other stuff before I cross this restaurant completely off my list.
author: Craig L.

description:
After just moving to the city recently, I've been on a constant prowl for the best sushi at an affordable price here. Wow did Nara set the bar high, absolutely loved my food and experience here.

I came in for a late dinner after doing some extra reading at a coffee shop nearby after work. Immediately I was taken aback because all the workers there shouted something at me in unison. At first I thought it was closed and they were telling me to leave because I couldn't understand any of it, but I later found out it's their way of welcoming all their customers. I loved the tradition. Pretty dark in the seating foray, very well lit at the bar (which is where I sat). The music playlist was on point, it's like they know exactly what you want to listen to when you're eating sushi. They also had a TV, although it's a tad of an awkward angle to see from the bar.

I ordered what was called the Sake Bomb roll and an order of their Spicy Edamame to have with my roll, not as an appetizer. Right after ordering a waitress brought me a glass and bottle of water. She left the bottle of water to refill it at my own pleasure with me. I drink a lot of water when I go out to restaurants so I was already enjoying my service at this point. My roll was riveting, tasted like that feeling of getting exactly what you want after working more than you needed to in a day. I ate the potato chips on top of it before actually eating the roll so that the salt from the chips wouldn't mask the flavor of the sushi. I was happy about that decision because the roll was flavorful to say the least. The dash of jalapeno in it went really well with the eel sauce drizzled on the plate. If you like a bit of spicy in your sushi, definitely get the Sake Bomb. The Spicy Edamame was a nice addition too: generously portioned, well cooked, buttery, and enough kick in them that you want to grab another after each bite. I should also note that all the chef's at the bar were super personable, willing to strike a conversation at any time, one was even singing along to the music playing my entire time there. Huge appreciation for Kevin who gave me free persimmons after my meal, really nice guy. 

The same way they greet you in unison, they thank you in unison as you're leaving too. I'm happy to live only a few blocks away, will definitely be coming back whenever I work more than I need to again.
author: Shayan S.

description: This place is amazing! The lower Haight needed a great sushi spot! Fish is fresh and delicious, beautiful sake selection. The place just opened but I feel can become the new sushi spot in the area! And staff is very friendly! Food is bangarang !
author: Angelyne T.

description:
Lower Haight has been seriously lacking good sushi and it looks like the answer has finally come! Love the atmosphere at Nara- very cool dining room, great service, fun special board behind the sushi bar. 
HIGHLY recommend the hand roll sampler- fantastic portions and delicious fish, very fun opener. We had the Boss roll- also very good, recommend if you generally like rainbow roll. The Loco Spiderman that was spicy and sweet and crunchy and soft- great stuff! Shout out to whoever picked the awesome early 2000s playlist that was going in the background... Very much added to the mood :)
author: Alma A.

description:
There are two things I look for when dining at a restaurant: service and food. Nara delivers on both fronts with fresh fish and spectacular staff. 

During my short stay in San Francisco, Nara was one of the few places I visited multiple times and would definitely visit again if I ever return. Their special fish imported every Wednesday sells out extremely fast and for good reason. The freshness is the key component to many of their dishes that allow the ingredients to speak for themselves. 

Combined with the excellent eats is amazing staff. Both times I went, George was extremely accommodating since he knew I would be flying back to Canada very soon. A ridiculously down-to-Earth and humble guy, I am amazed at how sociable and friendly he is. I wish him and Nara the best of luck as they truly deliver outstanding service and food.

If you visit, be sure to go early on a Wednesday night for their special!
author: Brendan S.

description: Happy Hour dollar oysters were amazing! Totally worth it!
author: Bella B.

description: Solid! Get the heart attack - you won't regret it!
author: Tim H.

description:
If you are looking for the good sushi, go elsewhere 

It is a bar.
Party place.
Party tables.
Lot of drunks 
Very loud. 
But tuna and salmon are not fresh on Friday night. 
Period.
author: Den P.

description: Amazing sushi really fresh and delicious nigiri hands down. But service was awful and the prices too much. We were here for an experience. Put our names down and they lost our name on the list sober were forgotten. They immediately sat us after our complaint but it was more of a "hurry and get them out" feel. Service was awful. 3 different servers hovered and kept repeating questions and one even brought the check before our meal was even done. Thanks for making us feel so welcome. Wouldn't go back for it; too bad.
author: Zara S.

description:
I have ventured all over the city in the name of good sushi. Finally, it's in my own backyard! 

The menu is unique and delightfully unexpected. Delicate and fresh, these fish dishes leave you feeling both renewed and satisfied. The staff greets all at the door and is courteous and attentive. The owner was here on his one night off during opening week and answered all of our questions and even served up some special treats for us to try! We regularly visited the Polk Street one and he recalled some of our previous chats. 

My second visit was the same (I was writing this review when they came around and offered some drink samples at the sushi bar!) They were very accommodating with specific meal adjustments and aimed to please! I will definitely visit as much as my free time allows! Hope to see you there!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Excellent service! The sake recommendation was awesome. Our appetizer the Shrek was fantastic and I would recommend if you love avocado. Loved loved loved the heart attack roll!
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Nara is the best! I went to Nara last Monday with my family for a birthday dinner and not only did they take really amazing care for our party of 10 the food was absolutely amazing. Very fresh selection of fish! Overall amazing experience and would definitely recommend for any occasion!
author: Q L.

description:
Haven't really been around this area but I loved the decor inside the restaurant. Immediately walked in and got a huge welcome from all the staff. Came in with a group of 3 with reservations at 8. Not many people around this time on a Friday night but got pretty packed around 9. Prices not too bad. 

Things we got:
-Hamachi truffle appetizer was amazing. Was extremely happy with every spoonful.
-Desperaso with butter fish was not worth it. 4 pieces and lots of decorative additions but took away from the fish.
-Half dozen oysters for $11. Extremely refreshing. 
-Chicken karage was pretty great. Comes in spicy version and not spicy. We got the non-spicy which comes with a ranch like sauce and a spicy mayo. Saw the spicy version at the table next to us and it looked pretty good.
-Vegetable tempura was light but literally one piece of each vegetable listed from the menu.
-we ordered three rolls: Sake bomb, heart attack, and big boss. If you're a fish lover, the big boss is for you. Rolls were pretty tiny and not that impressive. 

Overall: rolls weren't really worth it. Will try the Nigri instead. Awesome music but it was really loud and I had to yell over the music and other customers to have a conversation.  I'm giving it a 4 for great customer service and decor.
author: Katy C.

description: Absolutely the worst place! As a local to the area (10 minute walk over 15 years) it's sad that this place can not get their sheet together. Feb. 22nd our group of four came in for dinner (Friday night) understandable they're busy. The group ahead of us left which should have been an indication of a poor service place. They we're unorganized and un-accommodating. Do not go to Nara unless you want, you and group to be disappointed!
author: Pstephan A.

description: This is becoming my go to sushi spot when i'm in the Lower Haight. The rolls are pretty good, and the various apps, mains, and dessert are also tasty (pork belly, short ribs, tako balls, tofu, green tea ice cream). You can do some damage at happy hour too: $1 oysters, various beer and sake specials. Ohh and is that 90's hip hop and r&b you hear in the background? Why yes it is! And is that the warriors game on the T.V.? Yess
author: Mike P.

description:
Long time fan of Nara's polk location.  This place kicks it up a notch.  Exceptional sushi at very reasonable prices.  Sushi chefs are accommodating and will make custom rolls that aren't on the menu.  

Very fresh, nice decor, and Guns N' Roses in the background. :) 

I hope I can enjoy them before the secret gets out and seats won't be available.  

Recommendations: Unagi Spring, Hamachi Toro, Desperado,Chicken Karaage, Miso Soup,Sake Bomb(special)
author: Zibbie N.

description:
Finally!  A great restaurant in Lower Haight!  This is my new go-to place.  The food is amazing.  Even if I did not live in the neighborhood, I would go out of my way to go here.

My only complaint is about the noise level.  The acoustic control is not well designed; a professional should be brought in to help adjust the acoustics as the restaurants is small and one room.
author: A T.

description: Arrived at 5pm with a 10+ group.  They were accommodating and friendly service.  Food was delicious, great sake selections, and atmosphere was great.  I would recommend!
author: Leyla C.

description: This place is epic. Finally a good sushi restaurant in Lower Haight! Great beer and sake selection, great food and all at very reasonable prices. Definitely recommended.
author: Michael R.

description: The 8-hour Spanish sous-vide octopus is amazing. They just put it on the specials wall last week.
author: Rosie F.

description: I had such a great experience at Nara! I came with a few friends and Yumi was such a kind waitress. I highly recommend going there when she's working because her service is on point! Other than that the sushi rolls are delicious and the ramen is pretty darn good. Yumi suggested Yuzu for our drink of the night and its probably one of the best drinks I've ever had! :) Thanks Yumi!
author: Regina S.

description: I've been here a couple of times and I have had good experiences during all occasions. Most recently, I made a reservation for 8pm with a large group without any issue. We ordered the oysters, the big boss roll, jessica alba roll, loco spider roll and sake bomb roll. The winner was the sake bomb roll all around. The only downside was that we constantly had to ask a waiter for napkins, more orders and whatnot since we barely saw ours. It was extremely busy during that time though. Nevertheless, I would recommend coming back here! Their kimchi tacos were a hit whenever I came here but unfortunately were not on the menu this time. Try them if you get a chance!
author: Kathleen T.

description: Love this place! Its stylish and has an energetic and fun vibe, especially when sitting at the sushi bar. Service is always good, and its great for happy hour oysters and drinks specials. I also highly recommended the bacon wrapped asparagus and tomatoes, oysters, tempura jalapenos filled with spicy tuna, lamb chops and the green tea icecream dessert! Yum!
author: James M.

description: Okay place for late night sushi... Food was hit or miss depending on what you order. The hamachi truffle was not bad, though the jalapeno was way too spicy for me. I didn't really care for any of the specialty rolls we tried. Not sure I'd come here again. Maybe if it was late night and I really had a sushi craving as this place is open later than most sushi spots.
author: Aleyna S.

description:
I've been coming here since they are opened and they never disappoint me. They have high quality/fresh fish and staffs are always friendly. 
So worth to try this place!
author: Jerry K.

description:
Tried the new Japanese / sushi concept restaurant in Lower Haight last night with some friends. 

The place looks great inside, very welcoming and comfortable environment. 

The food was good, a couple hits and misses. The unagi spring roll was great, really fresh and light flavors, as was the roll with cream cheese and salmon. The scallop sliders were great too. The pop rocks California roll was terrible - I like the initiative, but the ultra sweet candy didn't mix with sushi flavors. 

The host brought us free sake, the wait staff was friendly and overall the service was top notch. Presentation of the food was awesome, but they have a few kinks to iron out in the menu before it's a 5 star for me.

Overall, a great night, some new dishes that broke out from the norm, beautiful presentation and great service. Excited to see what menu changes they make as the place matures.
author: Jake L.

description: Not a traditional Japanese but we knew that before going.  Food was delicious and the service was one of the best I have ever had.  Let the waiter suggest what to have.  They did a phenomenal job and had a blast.  We will definitely return.
author: Jordi P.

description: Decent food, not great. Handed the waiter "Stan" a few cards, and he proceeded to "accidentally" charge one card the whole amount, and then failed to undo it. Unprofessional and very off-putting.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: I can't say enough good things about Nara. We received great service, the food was delicious, and the owner sent us dessert. I'll be back often. Recommendations: Handroll tasting and Heart Attack are not to be missed.
author: Makela C.

description:
Don't be unconvinced that this place isn't 5 stars since it has so few reviews: it just opened!

From the first time I walked in (when the whole staff started shouting welcome), to my delicious raw fish, to the amazing ambiance, decorations and music, the experience was an all-around 5 star.

Still unconvinced? Try it out, I dare you. Blows the rest of the neighborhood's sushi places out of the water. Completely leveled up.

The only issue we had was that near the beginning, several different (3) staff came to take our order (had to tell them we had already ordered). It was opening night though and everyone was just so excited to take care of their customers. It seemed like they improved on this through the meal itself.
author: Peter M.

description:
I really like the atmosphere of this place and really wanted to enjoy the food, too.  Our servers were so nice and likable.

Sushi was fresh and sashimi was good quality for the price.  The drink menu is great, lots to choose from and very fun.

But in the end the prepared food has to guide the review.  And the fusion-y food that came out of the kitchen was just not working for me.  I really wanted to be surprised by the seafood pancake with cheese and fresh arugula.  But the flavors fought hard against each other and we left over half of it uneaten.

The jalapeno poppers felt as though the jalapenos were overly raw and crunchy, which was a strange counterpoint to the mushy fish filling.  

I hope some of the dishes on the kitchen menu can be replaced with items that keep up with the front of house and sushi bar.
author: Lorin Y.

description:
The Polk St. Nara has always been a favorite of mine. They have really out done themselves with the Lower Haight location. The vibe, music, and food are all 5 stars. Not to mention the service.  I can understand the one 4 star reviews mentioning kinks working out. But they are trying something a little different with the menu. It's hard to explain but it's not the same sushi items you're used to at every other sushi restaurant. I'm excited to see how much they continue to improve and am confident with it still at a 5 start status despite their experimentation with excellence.

Writing this review is making me hungry for Nara. I wish they did lunch.
author: Blake M.

description: All of the dishes were excellent. There was a slow-cooked, sous-vide octopus dish that was particularly exquisite. Great rolls, fresh fish, nice atmosphere. This review would have been a five except that at one point an obnoxiously loud birthday song came on--so loud that everyone in the place had to stop talking--and I was terrified because it was my birthday. Luckily my friend hadn't told anyone!--and the server brought out a candlelit dessert to another table. It had been such a pleasant, absorbing dinner until the birthday blitz. Still, I'd highly recommend Nara (just don't tell anyone if it's your birthday).
author: X-topher B.

description: Everything we has was excellent. I love that they offer soy paper for the rolls!  Spicy chicken and pork buns were my favorite among the cooked food we had.
author: Daniel A.

description: Head and shoulders above other Japanese restaurants. Everything is fresh and their house specials (posted on the wall behind the chefs) are superb. As a bonus, Nara opens late on Fri & Sat.
author: Scary K.

description: I really liked this restaurant! Was visiting San Francisco and I wanted sushi so I looked on Yelp and found this place close to where we were staying. I tried calling for over an hour to make a reservation, but the line was constantly busy, I'm guessing off the hook, so we just hoped for the best and showed up. We came in around 9pm on a Saturday night and there were plenty of people in the restaurant but we didn't have to wait for a table. Our server was a lot of fun, when we first sat down I wanna say he was doing Sake bombs with the table next to us lol. They have beer and wine (no liquor) which is great although they didn't have a single light beer on the menu, I would suggest adding Kirin Light or even something like Bud Light to the drink menu. Anyway the server was very helpful with deciding what to order, although he sort of guided us to order less than we probably would have because he said it was a lot of food, which it wasn't really, but it ended up being just about enough since we were going out drinking anyway and I was glad to not feel super full all night. First off the Hamachi Truffle appetizer was OUT OF THIS WORLD!! So freaking delicious. Then we had 2 specialty sushi rolls that were good, nothing spectacular that particularly stood out as a must try, but they were certainly yummy. We also had the spicy hand roll sampler and that was good. I really liked the vibe of this place and I would definitely check it out again if I was in the area.
author: Amber M.

description: Pretty decent place for sushi. The rolls were not the best I've had in the city but decent. Great atmosphere in lower Haight. They have TV screens so it's more of a casual place - not super date-y. But a great casual joint if you're looking for some Japanese food in the area. It's also near a lot of bars so it's a convenient starting point for a casual night out.
author: Wei W.

description: This place is AMAZING! We came here for my boyfriends birthday (24 of us), and were not the quietest group. Our waiter, I believe his name was George, was also AMAZING. We did so many sake bombs, ordered so much food, and everything was right on par. We couldn't have asked for a better place to celebrate. Thank you!!
author: Nadia K.

description: Quick drop in for HH oysters, beer, and orders of hotate, walu, and uni nigiri. All fresh but nigiri kinda small.  Come for small bites then head to Rosamunde for tasty sausages!
author: Ben M.

description: Loved the atmosphere and the food was even better. I had the Jessica alba roll and it was the best and most fresh sushi I've had in a while. Can't wait to come back!
author: Kristina S.

description:
This place comes up when you search "izakaya" but I wouldn't consider it a true izakaya; the menu is too limited and the presentation style and portion size is too small.  Some dishes are too small for even the best of friends to share--maybe two bites.  

This is a beef of mine about SF in general: there are all these restaurants that mimic the portion size and presentation of fine dining but aren't preparing food at that level-they're serving the same ingredients with the same preparation as everyone else, you just get less of it.  I'm not fooled!  I would much rather have the unpretentious presentation style and portion size of my local izakaya if you're just going to serve me the exact same quality of food. 

We had very little sushi since we came there in an "izakaya mood" but the food we had was mostly good.  Service isn't very good.  Our waitress was friendly and reasonably attentive but they just seemed a little overworked. 

Anyway, the small menu still had some great picks and there was enough there to keep us happy:

Bacon wrapped skewers - seemed like a winner, particularly the cherry tomato ones.
Agedashi tofu - hard to mess this up; it was decent
House salad - passable
Calamari - totally bland, tiny portion; top 3 worst calamari dishes i've ever had.
Tako balls - Perfection
Jessica Alba roll - very good; recommended
Loco Spiderman Roll - a little heavy on the creamy sauce but still very good
Spicy tuna hand roll - ate this to kill time while waiting for other stuff; decent
Black cod - impossibly small portion but served with a tasty mushroom medley
Jalapeno poppers - Very good
Chicken karage - I didnt eat this but others seems to enjoy it
Sake kama - only ordered this because they were out of the hamachi kama; enjoyed it

Above complaints aside, everything was reasonable and I would eat here again.
author: Jay S.

description: Nara has amazing quality fish, oysters, and service. I had the uni sushi roll which was fantastic, their $1 miyagi oysters, Saba nigiri, the white fish sampler and fish collar. Everything was incredible.
author: Trang N.

description: The sushi was good in general. However, there are many many other great sushi places in SF that you can get even better quality and taste with same price.
author: Sara K.

description:
Two stars mainly due the the atrocious service.
Walked in at 9:30pm and was told there would be a twenty minute wait, two parties were ahead of mine (I'm in a party of two). The hostess takes my number, I receive a text saying I'm on their waiting list, and once my table is ready I'd receive another text. Sounds good, I step outside. 

Fast forward thirty five minutes. I step inside to ask about my table and am told that everyone on the list had already sat down. I have a puzzled look on my face, as I never received a follow up text about my table being ready. They point at a table and tell us to sit down.. Sure. After ten to fifteen minutes of being ignored at the table, I walk up to a waitress and ask for menus. Another ten minutes go by and our waitress finally comes by, so we order two rolls, nigiri, water, and sake. We probably should have taken off for a new restaurant, but at this point it was passed 10 and our food options were limited.

By the time our order had been placed, an hour had gone by. We get our food (which actually came out fairly quickly) and dove in. Not the best sushi I've ever had, but not the worst. As I'm eating the sushi, I'm thinking to myself 'there's no way in hell this restaurant deserves the 4.5 stars on Yelp.' So, here I am.

Nara was average sushi and nigiri with some of the worst service I've experienced in a restaurant setting. I don't think I'd ever go back. This place needs a serious overhaul in the service department.
author: Steve E.

description: Best Sushi restaurant in San Francisco!!!! Service, freshness, atmosphere, and pricing are what makes this San Francisco gem so unique. As a Sushi snob I highly recommend Nara on Haight above all others.
author: Michael B.

description: This place is amazing, we had a reservation for 15 they had our table ready when we got there. The food was so delicious, the service was very good. For 15 peoe the bill was under 350 so in my book that is awesome. I would recommend anybody check out this place.
author: Mike P.

description: This is more fusion but there are some traditional elements. They do present their food very nicely and use really fresh ingredients. Also, the waitresses are very sweet!
author: Rudy G.

description: This is our go to place for sushi in our neighborhood. The specials are great and are always changing. The happy hour is every day of the week and the oysters are only $1 during the happy hour. The decor of the place is so cool and the staff is friendly and accommodating.
author: Courtney K.

description: So glad this place is in our neighborhood. Amazing, fresh sashimi and fun rolls. Staff is friendly and food is great! Certainly a new fav!!
author: Laura H.

description: From the moment we walked in we were greeted with smiles from every staff member. This new place is beautiful with modern finishes throughout and lovely lighting. Music went from upbeat Ray Charles to classic rock to some EDM. The service was impeccable with them replacing our water immediately and taking away our plates at just the right time. George is fantastic and he also introduced us to the other owner (apparently they own another sushi place on Polk street that's been in business over 14years). Now for the best part, the food! We had two Treasure Islands and California pop (a creative take on traditional California roll with pop rocks inside) that brought me back to my childhood. :) The hot sake and all other foods were delicious. Please try them they are going through their soft opening right now which will include FREE SAKE every Tuesday night what? Yes!
author: Yvonna C.

description: Great sushi, nice staff, decor and vibe. A bit pricey but not too surprising for SF. We had calamari, Jessica Alba roll and the Loco Spider roll, all of which were worth the price.
author: Dylan L.

description: Very very delicious! I particularly enjoyed the hamachi Truffle and the Spider-Man roll! A very great and unique experience for sushi lovers!
author: Parastoo M.

description: Decided to have an impromptu dinner here given the positive Yelp rating. The service was okay and the food was amazing. I was a little disappointed the miso soup seemed a little watered down and they didn't have any uni (sea urchin) despite arriving when they opened, on a weekend. Overall, still a great experience and great food. Recommend!
author: Justin R.

description: My first time here and it was so good! Sat at the bar and ordered the jessica alba roll and a rainbow roll- they were delicious and so FRESH! The ambiance is nice and getting there is fairly easy, although it took me a little to figure out where it was (in the dark.) it had good reviews on Yelp!, so I decided to try it out and I was not disappointed. I am definitely coming back. Thanks to the chefs. The food tasted great!
author: Reyna V.

description: Overall it was ok.  We did have an amazing snapper nigiri special that had its' skin torched and was super smoky and delicious.  But if you're into simple, delicious sushi that speaks for itself this place probably isn't for you. It wasn't really for me.  There were too many types of sushi in each roll and too many sauces.  There was something that sounded so delicious but then the description ended in ranch sauce and well....I think that's all I have to say.
author: a g.

description: Amazing quality, experimental, great service, with a fun atmosphere. Get ready to drink if you sit at the counter. The chefs are incredibly fun and love to cheers and top off your beers and or sake. This place will unfortunately be teeming with the hipster douche-baggery that engulfs so many of the better places here. But you know what, fuck it! Good I want this place to stay for a very very long time!! Chef Kevin and company deserve it! The staff is above and beyond what most try to be as well as the sushi!  Gonnichiniwa Bitches!
author: Ethan S.

description: I tried this place at freaky Friday and I absolutely loved the energy!! Fish was amazing and fresh with modern ambience!! Love love love!!
author: Brighter. K.

description: The Hamachi truffle dish: AHAMAZING!
author: Dorie S.

description: We walked in and the entire experience from beginning to end was great. We had an appetizer, a sushi roll, and the ramen. Everything was good and made fresh to order, the portions were all good sizes ad the service was great.(we walked in at 10:15pm) The beer was a little pricey.
author: Heather L.

description: Food was ok and service was awful, the server was trying to take my beer glass away while I was not even finish it. Hey, it's Monday night and you were not that too busy to kick us out. Not coming back
author: ZL L.

description: Good sushi, but the roll menu was much smaller than I thought it was going to be. I usually spend a small fortune at sushi joints, but here we spent $30 and left (2 rolls, 1 miso soup). I would like to see them expand their menu a bit. Atmosphere is nice but the music was a bit loud and a little silly (bad 80's/90's). Quality sushi overall though.
author: Katie S.

description: It was really chic but also cute place! I was so surprised by its own unique menus. Really delicious!!
author: Hye-il S.

description: These guys are so nice!  they even remember me as I work nearby and pick up to go pretty regularly.  However, the in house experience is totally worth sticking around. always a festive party environment.  The fish is super fresh and the booze are highly recommended.
author: Amy S.

description: I've been to Nara five times now and I'm impressed every time. The oysters are always great ($1 a piece for happy hour) and the sushi is superb. Prices are very reasonable. The sake nigiri is always buttery and perfect. I've been recommending this place to my friends and colleagues alike. Don't ever change, Nara.
author: John L.

description: Great food and great atmosphere!  The Ramen and Spiderman Sushi Roll are always my go to! Absolutely amazing! Can't forget the staff is great, they are full of excitement and very helpful.
author: Katie P.

description: Easily the best sushi in the lower Haight. Among other things, the truffled hamachi is great because they actually use truffle oil to accentuate the natural taste rather than smothering it.
author: Dan M.

description: This place is incredible.  It's got it all.  Presentation,  ambiance,  and above all quality.  So fresh.  So delicious.  The chefs are thinking outside the average sushi bar! !!##chef kevin is mah man !!!!!!
author: Tina T.

description: Nara restaurant & sake bar automatically became one of my favorite places. I really enjoyed their food, drinks with great atmosphere and music. They have asian fusion styles of little dishes that people can enjoy with drinks at a reasonable price. I'd recommend this place to my friends or just go with them again!
author: Ji C.

description:
*finally, an actually legitimate sushi spot on haight, go nowhere else on haight* 
tonkotsu ramen | butterfish nigiri | gochujang oyster

I literally just walked out of that place 20 min. ago and felt I needed to write this. Although I do miss Greenburgers salted caramel milkshake...I think I'll be visiting Nara more than Greenburger's. I had no idea this was coming up here and very glad I stopped in. 

Great ambiance and incredibly friendly staff. I'll have to come back for the sushi. But this place puts a nice Korean twist on traditional sushi. For example...gochujang oyster, what better than a little spicy, sour kick to your oyster. And a comfortably spicy ramen dish wish fresh ingredients. First thing I noticed was how clean the sushi was prepared and how fresh all the ingredients were. 

Excited to check out more on the menu, but I think (and hope) this place is a keeper.
author: Kevin T.

description: Great staff and good hot sake! Can't wait to go back with my friends and hopefully sit at the bar, it looked like a lot of fun!
author: Valentina G.

description: This place is amazing! The manager, George, is super helpful about making recommendations for ordering. The Loco Spider-Man Roll is amazing!
author: E L.

description: Thoughtful, daring, fresh: the sushi, the sake menu, the wait staff, all. Don't miss it!
author: Susana D.

description:
First time here and I live in lower haight so ice been wanting to check it out since it opened and finally Made it happen yesterday. Sat at the sushi bar solo and had incredible service and overall great vibe in here.  Most importantly very fresh fish with some great items on the menu.  

I've been seeking out a great local sushi spot and genuinely couldn't be happier it has finally arrived.  Ichi type sushi spot with better fish and great staff
author: Benjamin K.

description: This is my first review on yelp and am doing so to hopefully keep this place in the neighborhood! After 3 visits I have still yet to try anything that is not amazing. Great sake selection and killer apps. The tonkotsu ramen is right up there with the best ive had in this city. Highly recommended!
author: Mike S.

description: Got there about 10 minutes before opening.  Door was open, but they told us to wait outside until they opened.  (no chairs to sit on to wait)  The sushi was decent.   Service was good, though it wasn't busy at the time.  A decent place for Happy Hour.  To be fair, I did not have a full dinner meal, so can not comment on that.
author: John I.

description: You can't beat great Sashimi and great Sake, and Nara delivers on both fronts! I highly recommend the Truffle Hamachi and Walu Tataki salad. Nara has some of the freshest sashimi I have had in San Francisco. Chef Kevin cares about the quality of his work, and you can see this from the attention to detail that goes into his Sashimi dishes. The atmosphere at Nara is also great for groups, I have been for a birthday and they definitely know how to help you celebrate. The sushi rolls are great too!
author: Patrick U.

description: Great wine, beer AND sake list, lovely environment in a lively  neighborhood and awesome staff!!
author: Lisa R.

description:
I thought the sushi was very good.  Both the hirame and salmon nigiri were fantastic.  Fish was very fresh, rice had the right amount of flavor, wasn't clumpy, and was at the right temperature. i usually don't order those large sushi rolls that have a lot of stuff going on, but I ordered the sake bomb here and it was really good - it had seared salmon, fresh salmon, spicy sauce, and crunchy crumbs.  the seared salmon just added an extra flavor that was delicious.

The tonkatsu ramen was meh.  Not a lot of depth to the flavor, especially compared to dedicated ramen places.

sound level was super loud, and they kept switching songs every 10 seconds or so while I was there, so that wasn't great.  I would probably come here regularly if it wasn't for the noise, because the sushi is good.
author: Yin L.

description: Delicious, very high quality, cozy environment, great date spot, good drinks.
author: Kevin A.

description: They have fresh sushi and sashimi but my favorite food in this restaurant is the polk belly and short rib! Their kitchen food are sooooo good!
author: Hana A.

description: I've been to this restaurant several times and they always satisfied me with friendly staffs and high quality. I would like to strongly recommend sashimi and nigiri which are reasonable price and super delicious. Don't waste your time to find different sushi restaurants.
author: Doyun K.

description: Having just moved here from New York, I'm happy to say I think I found my favorite new neighborhood go-to spot for Sushi.  Everything from the 90's R&B that happened to be playing to the sushi specials was incredible.  Great presentation on the food.  For dessert, we got the green tea ice cream over warm, gooey chocolate cake that was to die for.
author: Sarah M.

description: Service was great and sushi were fresh. Gotta try their unagi roll, hamachi, and escolar!!!
author: David K.

description:
Looking for a new place to eat sushi, I stumbled across this place on Haight, not too far from Ricky Bobby. 

The decor of the place indicates an intimate new trendy restaurant, but as soon as you enter the door, the entire staff will scream at you, to welcome you to the place. It's actually quite funny and welcoming.  But you do immediately notice the noise level of the place is quite high.

The music is an issue by itself.  For one, it's blasted continuously.  Very difficult to have a conversation imo.  Plus, the music choices at times make it seem like you are sitting in a bad karaoke bar. Not to mention, when it's time to celebrate someone's birthday, regular music will stop, and music taken from what seems to be from a japanese game show/variety show/ Kpop is taken up a few decibels and floods the entire place for a good 1-2 minutes, until the staff is done wishing the patron a happy birthday. It's quite jarring.

The staff is quite nice, welcoming, and attentive for the most part. Definitely a plus.

They have a nice selection of sake. Their drink menu is nicely done and even has an informative page at the end, describing each type of sake and the tastes you should expect to help make your choice. I'm not one to usually order sake, since I never know what to get, but I found myself ordering a small bottle due to the information they give you.  Nice touch.

The sushi itself is not very good imo.  I ordered both their nigiri and their sashimi tastings while my girlfriend ordered two of their rolls. The selection of novelty rolls themselves is very small compared to a typical sushi restaurant/bar.  That is perfectly fine, but the sushi you offer should be really good, unfortunately I don't believe it is. The two rolls we ordered were the 'Big Boss' and the Jessica Alba.  Yay for alba, nay for big boss. Shame, I love me some Metal Gear Solid.

The nigiri wasn't bad, just not great.  None of them seemed to be exceptionally fresh.   The sashimi also suffers from this and the portion size also seemed off.  The cuts were rather large and thick, which may seem like a good thing, but having a larger piece of fish with lower quality taste isn't really that appetizing. I also felt that some of the pieces of both sashimi/nigiri were over seasoned as well.

It's a decent place.  If you live in a different neighborhood, I don't think its worth the effort to come out, better going off to Ricky Bobby a few blocks down.  As a neighborhood sushi place, that you can easily stroll on in, sure why not.
author: Christopher M.

description: I just say here is good place here is different with the other japanes restaurant  not only traditional japan food nice fusion style
author: Rangsimant R.

description: I live in the neighborhood and thought I woulds stop by. Had the crispy salmon skin salad and veggie roll. Both were very good and the service was most excellent. Great vibes. I'll definitely be going back.
author: Ryan S.

description: The best sake bar in sf!! U must go this new place. Their dishes are amazing, and servers are very nice. :)
author: Hae L.

description: 5 stars for the pleasant vibe, excellent services and great food.  This sushi&sake bar restaurant opened less than a year ago n its been crowded every evening for many months already
author: MJ P.

description:
Do yourself a favor and try the California Poprocks. Hamachi Yellowtail Truffles are fatty sumptuous deliciousness. And do please read the sake menu. Special new tastes are there, if you are ready to enjoy life.
Kevin is the sushi chef you've been waiting to meet all these years. Tell him what you want and enjoy the imaginative and wonderful results.
author: Christopher F.

description: WOW!  This is the best sushi I've had in a while.  I have a place on my block that I order from regularly that is decent but this is where to go with a group of friends.  We tried so many rolls from the menu and everything was delicious.  Love, love, love this place!  Warning - long waits here.
author: Lenni R.

description: I've been twice (so far) and both experiences were great. The food is delicious (e.g, sliders, pork buns, spider roll, sake bomb roll, oysters) and the service is fantastic. The sake samplers are perfect for those who aren't aficionados.
author: Sebastian C.

description: atmosphere is pretty loud for a sushi restaurant. sake quality of fish was good but waiter had no idea which one was which. overall experience was a little too whitewashed for my preferences.
author: Jessica S.

description: High quality food and good service bi was worried about the choices because there are a lot of signature rolls with unusual things and I like pretty simple. I chose the Big Boss roll and it was right on the mark. He hand rolls were amazing. The maguro tartare was to die for and will keep me coming back. Excellent, excellent tuna!! And cherry in top, they are open late.
author: D F.

description: I'll preface this by saying I'm no expert in Japanese cuisine, so I have no authority to say this, but the food at Nara seemed very authentic to me. The sushi I had was delicious, some of the best I've had. The seaweed salad was amazing. The servers were lovely, and the space was well decorated. Overall a great experience. My only complaint is that it was pretty noisy, but sometimes you can't help that.
author: Eleanor H.

description: This place is not bad. Korean owned sushi place. I'm glad it's not that far from my hood. A good young ambiance and offers a lot of sake.
author: Clemencia S.

description: Very well done by the chef. Excellent and interesting choices for the nigiri and all prepared quite well.
author: T W.

description: fantastic food and service.  love this place.  the halloween theme was really cool. the sushi chefs are super nice and FAST.  Highly recommend.
author: Chuck T.

description: Just discovered this place have come back twice in a week. Fresh sushi and great fusion food in general! Let's hope they keep up the quality will return many times.
author: Joy G.

description:
Let me first just preface this by saying that this is the first time I have ever been compelled to write a review.  I have been to Nara twice in the last two weeks and both times I have left saying that I must write a review asap.  If you can't be bothered to read a longer break down you can stop here...Nara is great; go try for yourself.

Just to quickly highlight - the menu is reasonably priced, the interior is well designed and the playlist on both occasions has been great (Shaggy - Mr. Bombastic comes to mind).  Now for the more standout points that take Nara from good to great.  Both sushi dishes I have tried at Nara have been delicious and well crafted (I had the Desperado and the California Pop Rock one) - they were without a doubt the freshest sushi I have ever tasted.  As for some other items, they have been equally as delicious - the pork ramen is great with a touch of kick (and also without as my girlfriend requested); the calamari, again, extremely fresh and the seafood pancake is great.  I absolutely loved the atmosphere in Nara.  The interior and the playlist are a part of that but as is the service and the welcoming cheer/shouts thrown up by the whole staff whenever a patron walks in that always provokes a smile from me.  Finally the service is absolutely fantastic and makes you feel extremely valued as a customer.  I will admit, being from England where service is generally miserable, I am a sucker for delightful service, however my appreciation in this area is totally warranted.  The servers are extremely friendly and attentive and happy to talk through the menu with you.  On my first visit one of our dishes was delivered to another table meaning we had to wait and extra 7-8 minutes or so (not the biggest problem for me), however I was brought a beer on the house and that item was scratched from the menu too.  I mustn't forget to mention the manager who - even remembered me from my first visit - welcomes every patron with a wonderful smile and there to say goodbye on your way out too.

So my very first post has been a long one but I hope that tells you how much I have enjoyed my trips to Nara.  My only hope is that as they grow more popular they can keep the great service and quality of dishes!
author: Andoni G.

description: Very good but speak louder because You can have misunderstanding With orders and you paie for it !!!
author: Jean-michel V.

description: Excellent sushi.  I am very happy that a great sushi place finally opened in Lower Haight.  The sushi is really fresh and reasonably priced. They also have other unique appetizers to enjoy and add a variety to your meal.  The servers are all very friendly and happy, although they seem to share tables which leads to some confusion at times, and the space could use some acoustic dampeners on the ceiling. But these do not affect my five star review.  The place is great!  It's been open for just a short time and my wife and I have been there 4 times and I ordered take out once.
author: Adam B.

description: Thought the place was great. Sushi was delicious and they really make an art out of their dishes. Very elegant and beautiful placement of the food. I really appreciated seeing the owner of the restaurant there. The fact that he was there and helping his employees with the restaurant made me feel more obliged to support his efforts. He was serving and gave us a complimentary drink for having to wait for a table. Would definitely go back again.
author: Daniel S.

description: Went for first time tonight.  Friendly staff. Great space. I'm no sushi expert bug enjoyed everything we ordered. Will definitely return.
author: Rick F.

description: This place is amazing! Not only is George the best, but the food is absolutely delicious. I just moved to this town from NYC and it's the first place I've found that is open beyond grandma's bedtime. Sake bombs. The freshest fish. Pop rocks rolls?? So inventive and delicious. It's now part of our weekly routine. love you nara!!
author: A L.

description: The food here was actually pretty good.  Fresh ingredients and good flavors.  But it was hard to relax and enjoy the meal with the atmosphere of strained effort to impress.  The roll menu was limited and most of them sounded like over-the-top summer blockbuster movies.  If you're in the mood for something simple and low key, this isn't the place.
author: Bryan B.

description: The new sushi place in Lower Haight! Glad this neighborhood finally got some quality sushi. The specialty rolls are creative and come in generous quantities. The apps are also great. Just a well composed spot - great for a midweek night out.
author: Sandra S.

description: Just the best. I've lived in the Lower Haight for 6+ years and am FINALLY excited about a "local" sushi place.
author: Brian B.
